Most articles are either poorly sourced or linked to other questionable/conspiracy sources. LLN also promotes Islamophobia and uses questionable language when describing African Americans. This source is also on Politifact’s fake news list. (3/9/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

learnprogress.org.name: Learn Progress
learnprogress.org.notes: Learn Progress is a news and opinion website with an extreme left wing bias.  The website consists of articles with misleading headlines, loaded words and outrageous claims without sources.  Learn Progress is also on Politifact’s Fake News List. (12/13/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/28/2017)

liberalplug.com.name: Liberal Plug
liberalplug.com.notes:
History
Liberal Plug is a an extreme left wing news and opinion blog that does not have an about page. A Whois search reveals the domain was registered privately in 2016.
Funded by / Ownership
Liberal Plug does not list an owner, however articles are posted under the name Justin Soloman. The website is funded through online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
The Liberal Plug is a news and opinion website with extreme left wing bias. Articles utilize strong emotional loaded words that always favor the left such as this: Forget Just Resigning, Rep. Cummings Has Brutal Plan For Jeff Sessions, He’s In Huge Trouble. Some stories are outright fake news and most others are not properly sourced and amount to left wing propaganda. Liberal Plug is also on Politifact’s Fake News List. 
Overall, this is a Questionable source based on extreme left wing bias, promotion of propaganda and the publishing of fake news. (1/19/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/18/2018)

liberalsociety.com.name: Liberal Society
liberalsociety.com.notes: Liberal Society is an extreme left news and opinion website. Liberal Society does not source to credible information and promotes left wing propaganda. (D. Van Zandt 2/4/2017)

liberalspeak.com.name: Liberal Speak
liberalspeak.com.notes: Liberal Speak is a news and opinion website with an extreme left wing bias in reporting. All articles favor the left and discredit the right through the use of loaded emotional words in the headlines and content of articles. There is rarely presentation of both sides of a story and sourcing typically comes from left wing or other questionable sources such as Real Time Politics or propaganda sites such as the Palmer Report. Liberal Speak does make an effort to use proper credible sources, but ultimately they cannot be taken seriously when sourcing questionable sources who have failed many fact checks. Overall, this is an extreme left biased website that uses sensational headlines and is poorly sourced. (D. Van Zandt 8/4/2017)

libertybrief.com.name: Liberty Brief
libertybrief.com.notes: Liberty Brief is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right bias in reporting. Virtually every article is either against Obama or Clinton. It also is highly pro-Trump. Unfortunately, virtually every article on the front page is straight from the propaganda playbook. There is just enough facts for the author to make outrageous assertions that are highly misleading. In one such article, Liberty Brief is very upset that the Obama’s have signed a deal with a speaking agency. In her words: “the Obamas have now figured out a brand new way to con our country and rake in millions while sitting on their lazy asses.” One has to wonder what the author is implying when referring to the Obama’s as lazy? In short, Liberty Brief is a virtual credible website. In reality it is questionable.(D. Van Zandt 3/23/2017)

liberty-courier.com.name: Liberty Courier
liberty-courier.com.notes: The Liberty Courier is an extreme right wing news and opinion website. Every single article has a sensational headline that usually isn’t true. A simple fact check on just the headlines will reveal that most stories are either false, taken out of context or misleading. This source is somewhere between overt propaganda and fake news. Here is a Pants on Fire fact check from Politifact, regarding Vince Foster’s death being ruled a homicide. This source has also been added to Politifact’s fake news list. (4/13/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

libertyisviral.com.name: Liberty is Viral
libertyisviral.com.notes: Liberty is Viral is an extreme right biased news and opinion website. Most information on this website is sourced to other questionable or far right sources. This is a classic propaganda website. (D. Van Zandt 3/11/2017)

libertywritersnews.com.name: Liberty Writers News
libertywritersnews.com.notes: Liberty Writers News is a highly biased extreme right wing website that re-posts news from other sources with very strong opinions and highly sensational healdines.  Liberty Writers News has been accused and admitted to publishing fake news stories here,  here and here. Although there has been multiple stories written about this website, there still is not an about page or disclaimer indicating this is meant to be satire. Until that time we must assume this is a propaganda website that deliberately publishes misleading stories for the purpose of clicks. (9/20/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/5/2017)

londonwebnews.com.name: London Web News
londonwebnews.com.notes: London Web News is an extreme left biased news aggregator website, which includes news stories taken from many places, including reliable news sources. However, sometimes London Web News publishes fictional news stories, such as Kellyanne Conway allegedly saying “Liberal Women Hate Me Because Of My “Striking Beauty And Intellect”, which fact checkers, Politifact and Snopes rated as false. Overall, we rate London Web News Questionable based on extreme left wing bias and the promotion of fake news stories. (M. Huitsing 9/11/2017)

loonwatch.com.name: LoonWatch
loonwatch.com.notes: According to LoonWatch’s about page they are a blogzine run by a motley group of hate-allergic bloggers to monitor and expose the web’s plethora of anti-Muslim loons, wackos, and conspiracy theorists. While Media Bias Fact Check rates Islamophobic websites as questionable, we must also rate a site that demonizes any criticism of Islam, even radical Islam as being equally questionable. We admire this website for tackling the true prejudices and crimes against Muslims, but they even go so far as to attack an atheist comedian. This is a propaganda site. (D. Van Zandt 4/2/2017)

loser.com.name: Loser.com
loser.com.notes: Loser.com is a domain name which existed as a URL redirect to several different webpages during most of its existence. As of April 2017, it is a news website that publishes articles opposing Donald Trump.

madamericannetwork.com.name: Mad American Network
madamericannetwork.com.notes: Mad American Network is a news/podcast website run by Dave Martel. According to their own description “Dave Martel and co. bring you the freshest Memes, Articles, Commentary and Podcasts. 100% original content.”

magapill.com.name: MagaPill
magapill.com.notes:
History
According to the MagaPill about page: “MAGAPILL is here to ensure that President Trump’s Legacy is properly documented. It’s been recently reported that 95% of the News Media’s coverage of Trump is Negative, while only 5% is positive. This is the definition of an unfair bias and one of the main reasons why everyday American’s confidence in the “Main Stream” media is at an all time low.”
Funded by / Ownership
MagaPill does not disclose ownership and the website is funded through online advertising and donations.
Analysis / Bias
In review, the MagaPill website consists of links to archived news stories that highlight Donald Trump’s accomplishments as President. For the most part they link to mainstream news sources, however they also often to link to the Alt-Right website Breitbart, which has a poor track record with fact checkers. MagaPill has also been highlighted as a fake news, conspiracy website by the credible conservative Weekly Standard. MagaPill frequently uses their Twitter account to promote conspiracy theories such as the Seth Rich Murder.
A factual search reveals a failed fact check.
Overall, this is a Questionable source based on promotion of one sided Donald Trump propaganda, debunked conspiracy theories and some false claims. (D. Van Zandt 11/27/2017) Updated (10/14/2018)

martinlutherking.org.name: MartinLutherKing.org
martinlutherking.org.notes: MartinLutherKing.org is owned and run by the same people who run the white nationalists website Stormfront. Stormfront is considered a hate group by the Southern Poverty Law Center. The purpose of MartinLutherKing.org is to discredit the legacy of Martin Luther King. The website is riddled with false information that simply amounts to racism and hate. (D. Van Zandt 6/24/2017)

mbganews.com.name: MBGA – Make Britain Great Again
mbganews.com.notes: MBGA (Make Britain Great Again) is an alt-right, anti-immigrant media outlet and Luke Nash-Jones is the Editor-in-Chief. His about page describes him as a “passionate campaigner for proper Brexit, who opposes open borders and Sharia law”

mediazone.news.name: Media Zone
mediazone.news.notes: Media Zone is a news and opinion website with extreme right wing bias in reporting. This source also does not shy away from fake news, conspiracies and propaganda. (D. Van Zandt 11/6/2016)

en.metapedia.org.name: Metapedia
en.metapedia.org.notes: Metapedia is an electronic encyclopedia which contains far-right, white nationalist, white supremacist, white separatist, antisemitic, Holocaust denial and neo-Nazi points of view. Metapedia is considered a purveyor of hate as a white nationalist source according to the Southern Poverty Law Center. This source is not credible. (D. Van Zandt 1/13/2017)

memri.org.name: Middle East Media Research Institute (MEMRI)
memri.org.notes: Founded in February 1998, according to it’s about page, MEMRI or Middle East Media Research Institute states its purpose as distributing English translations of Middle Eastern media. MEMRI describes itself as “Independent, nonpartisan, nonprofit, 501(c)3 organization” and they state that they cover “original analysis of political, ideological, intellectual, social, cultural, and religious trends.”

milo.yiannopoulos.net.name: MILO News
milo.yiannopoulos.net.notes: Milo Yiannopoulos is a British media personality associated with the political alt-right and a former senior editor for Breitbart News. Describing himself as a “cultural libertarian,” he is a vocal critic of feminism, Islam, social justice, political correctness, and other movements and ideologies he sees as authoritarian or left wing. MILO News publishes right wing biased news with the use of loaded words and sensational headlines. MILO is not a fake news site as they publish mostly real news, however it is on the extreme end of right wing. Milo Yiannopoulos has made some false and outrageous statements that have both made him popular with some segments and loathed by others. We rate this source questionable based on extreme bias and outrageous statements made by the author. We recommend following this Link to Rationalwiki for a detailed list of his false claims and controversies. (D. Van Zandt 5/11/2017)

molonlabemedia.com.name: Molon Labe Media
molonlabemedia.com.notes: Molon Labe Media has extreme far right bias that is over the top.  They consistently publish right wing conspiracy theories that can easily be mistaken for satire.  Sadly, the content  of this site is not satire! It appears to be unintentional or intentional fake news. (D. Van Zandt 10/3/2016)

movingleft.com.name: Moving Left
movingleft.com.notes: Moving Left is a news and opinion blog with an extreme left wing bias. Moving left uses strong loaded words in both sensational headlines and in articles. The sources for articles are typically from far left sources or questionable sources such as Truth Examiner. We rate Moving Left questionable based on poor sourcing and extreme bias. (D. Van Zandt 5/5/2017)

mrcblog.com.name: Mr. Conservative (MRC)
mrcblog.com.notes: Mr. Conservative is an extreme right wing news blog that has been flagged for posting false information. All headlines contain loaded words and many use questionable language when talking about race. This source is simply unreliable for credible information. (D. Van Zandt 3/5/2017)

myrightamerica.com.name: My Right American
myrightamerica.com.notes:
History
My Right American or myrightamerica.com is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. My Right American describe the sites goal in their about page as “My Right America is a group of proud Americans who believe that conservatives should be bold in our views and opinions.” 
Funded by / Ownership
My Right American does not list who owns and/or edits this website. The website generates revenue though online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
In review, My Right American publishes stories with loaded emotional headlines such as “Chilling: Assassination Attempt Backfires, He Is still Alive…Trump Is Furious!” All stories published favor the right while being anti-left. My Right American also frequently publishes stories that are negative toward African Americans and Muslims. In general, they rewrite news stories published by credible sources such as the Independent Journal Review. However, they also utilize factually mixed sources such as the Daily Caller, Breitbart, and questionable sources such as the Conservative Tribune and conspiracy sites such as Infowars. 
Overall, we rate My Right American Questionable based on extreme right wing bias, poor sourcing, promotion of propaganda/conspiracies and a complete lack of transparency. (M. Huitsing 11/28/2017) Updated (1/19/2019)

myzonetoday.com.name: MyZoneToday
myzonetoday.com.notes: MyZoneToday is a far right biased news website/blog.  This source sometimes publishes conspiracy theories and is not factual in other cases. Some news is just fake. (D. Van Zandt 11/11/2016)

mygoogle.ca.name: Nation45
mygoogle.ca.notes: Nation45 (if that is the actual name) is an extreme right imposter website with the domain mygoogle.ca. It doesn’t look like Google though. It looks like a blog. Nation45 is the person who apparently writes the content for this blog, though one cannot tell as the website does not have a name, an about page, or contact information. The news reported uses extreme loaded language such as “Yes! Democrat Scumbag Arrested!” Articles that are actually sourced are linked to other questionable sources. In short, this is an imposter site with extreme right wing bias that publishes fake news. (D. Van Zandt 8/30/2017)

natall.com.name: National Alliance
natall.com.notes: The National Alliance is a white supremacist, neo-Nazi, anti-semitic and white separatist political organization. It was founded by prominent white supremacist William Luther Pierce in 1974, and was based in Hillsboro, West Virginia. Membership in 2002 was estimated at 2,500 with an annual income of $1 million. Membership declined after Pierce’s death in 2002, and after a split in its ranks in 2005, the group has been barely functioning. At this point the National Alliance has merged and become National Vanguard, which holds the same policy positions. On the National Alliance website they publish stories directly from the National Vanguard that are white supremacist. The Southern Poverty Law Center has both groups classified as hate groups. Overall, we rate the National Alliance as Questionable based on being an extreme right hate group. (D. Van Zandt 10/3/2017)

nationaleconomicseditorial.com.name: National Economics Editorial
nationaleconomicseditorial.com.notes: National Economics Editorial (NEE) is a news site that purports to support Economic Nationalism. While NEE does cover some economic issues it is, as the name implies, mainly an editorial site. The opinions expressed in the stories cover current affairs with a pronounced right wing bias. NEE is, on the whole, long on rhetoric and short on factual content and credible sourcing. Due to the overt bias and lack of factual information, NEE is rated Questionable. (D. Kelley 3/29/2017)

nationalenquirer.com.name: National Enquirer
nationalenquirer.com.notes:
History
The National Enquirer is an American supermarket tabloid published by American Media Inc (AMI) that was founded in 1926. The Enquirer openly acknowledges that it will pay sources for tips, a practice generally disapproved of by credible press. The current editor is Dylan Howard.
Funded by / Ownership
The National Enquirer is owned by American Media, Inc., which is a publisher of magazines, supermarket tabloids, and books based in New York City. The current CEO of AMI is David Pecker who is a close personal friend to President Donald Trump. The tabloid is funded through magazine sales and advertising.
Analysis / Bias
The National Enquirer is well known for publishing outrageous and sometimes fake news stories. One could even say that they are the original fake news media outlet that profits by selling fake news. While most news on their website is not fake, the majority however, is sensationalized gossip that is not well sourced to credible information. A sample headline reads: Hillary Clinton: White House Dream Is Over! In this article they claim Clinton has 6 months to live, which is patently false. Here is the cover of the magazine:

According to reporting by The Associated Press, during the 2016 United States Presidential election, stories that supported Donald Trump or attacked his rivals bypassed the newspaper’s standard fact checking process.  In general, stories regarding politics have a right wing bias in selection, especially as it relates to President Trump.
A factual search reveals too many failed fact checks to list.
Overall, we rate the National Enquirer Questionable based on the routine publishing of sensational or fake news stories. (D. Van Zandt 7/12/2017) Updated (7/20/2018)

npiamerica.org.name: National Policy Institute
npiamerica.org.notes: The National Policy Institute (NPI) is an alt right, white nationalist, and white supremacist think tank based in Arlington, Virginia. The current president of NPI is Richard Spencer, who is an admitted white supremacist (racist) and founder of the Alternative Right blog. This is a hate group according to the Southern Poverty Law Center. (D. Van Zandt 10/6/2016)

nationalvanguard.org.name: National Vanguard
nationalvanguard.org.notes: Founded in 2005, National Vanguard is an alt-right white supremacy organization founded and run by Kevin Alfred Strom, who is a former member of the National Alliance, which is a white supremacist, neo-Nazi, anti-Semitic and white separatist political organization. Kevin Alfred Strom, according to NBC29 and ABC News, on January 4, 2007 he was arrested on charges of possession of child pornography and witness tampering. Charlottesville Newspaper, The Daily Progress reports in 2008, Strom was sentenced to 23 months in prison on a child pornography charge.

indigenous.club.name: Native Americans
indigenous.club.notes: Where to even begin?  http://indigenous.club/ is claiming to be a Native American non profit. A quick trip to their Facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/us.native.americans/ provides you that they are categorizing themselves as a “Magazine.”

powerofnative.com.name: Native American News
powerofnative.com.notes: Native American News is a news and opinion website that does not have an about page. The stories on Native American News are sensational and ridiculous. Since this source does not disclose whether it is satire or not, we must assume it is serious. Many stories are simply fake news, such as NASA reporting that the earth will be in darkness for 15 days in November 2017. Most other stories are either rooted in conspiracy, pseudoscience or is just plain fake. Overall, we rate Native American News Questionable due to publishing fake news stories. (D. Van Zandt 11/19/2017)

neverrepublican.com.name: NeverRepublican.com
neverrepublican.com.notes: NeverRepublican.com is an extreme left biased news and opinion blog. As the name implies every story is pro-left and anti-right. There is excessive use of loaded words that favor the left. NeverRepublican.com is extremely biased against Donald Trump and sells T-Shirts and Mugs that state: FU Trump. There is very little sourcing as virtually every article is an opinion piece. Overall, this a Questionable source based on extreme left wing bias, poor sourcing and promotion of propaganda. (D. Van Zandt 11/11/2017)

nevo.news.name: Nevo News
nevo.news.notes: Nevo News has extreme right wing bias with sensational stories that are generally unproven conspiracies.  Nevo News is not trustworthy for factual news. (D. Van Zandt 10/18/2016)

newcenturytimes.com.name: New Century Times
newcenturytimes.com.notes: New Century Times also known as NCT is an online news website that publishes news with an extreme left wing bias.  This source also does not source all articles and many stories are not factual. Promotes left wing propaganda. (D. Van Zandt 11/18/2016)

newsandstoriesfromusa.com.name: News and Stories From USA
newsandstoriesfromusa.com.notes: Welcome to our new reality.  It’s not going to change anytime soon it seems. It started, who knows when at this point and it seems to only grow.  Also, who knows if its just Russian Trolls that are doing it now or if there are other countries and even inside actors doing it,  but you can certainly trace many of these types of articles and “news” to sites that track known Russian “troll” accounts in twitter, Facebook and Russian News sites like RT.

newsconservative.com.name: News Conservative
newsconservative.com.notes: News Conservative is an extreme right wing news website that does not use credible sources. In fact, many times they source to fake news satire websites such as The Last Line of Defense and Our Land of the Free. Both of these sources have a disclaimer stating they are satirical. They also source to other questionable sources such as Conservative 101, which does not claim to be satire. Since News Conservative does not have an About page or a Disclaimer, indicating they are a satire website, we have to assume this is a fake news website that is attempting to mislead people. Here is an example of a fake story that is sourced to a satire website: “BREAKING: SASHA OBAMA REMOVED FROM SCHOOL IN HANDCUFFS.”  Overall, this is an extreme right biased fake news website. (M. Huitsing 10/6/2017)

newnation.org.name: New Nation News
newnation.org.notes: New Nation News sole purpose is to post news about black on white crime. The mission of this website is to show that blacks are dangerous and a threat to whites. This is one of the most overtly racist websites I have reviewed. I provide a link below, but I caution against clicking on it. (D. Van Zandt 7/2/2017)

newpoliticstoday.com.name: New Politics Today
newpoliticstoday.com.notes: New Politics Today is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing and anti-Muslim bias. Out of 10 articles reviewed, 8 were portraying Muslims negatively. New Politics Today also rarely sources to credible media outlets, instead using conspiracy sites and questionable sources to support their stories. Rather than being a fake news source this is simply a propaganda site for the extreme Alt-right. However, it is listed on Politifact’s Fake News List. (D. Van Zandt 4/12/2016)

newsblaze.com.name: News Blaze
newsblaze.com.notes: News Blaze is a conservative online news site that describe itself as: “News Blaze is the alternative business and world news newspaper, with entertainment, music, politics, and the latest breaking news and videos.” News Blaze has extreme right wing bias in reporting, such as: “George Soros The Terrorist Financier”. Most of their political news favors the right and is anti-left. They also frequently use emotion invoking rhetoric in their headlines and articles. Sometimes they refer to factually mixed sources such as RT and other times they don’t source at all and promote conspiracies, such as this: “As The Deep State Unravels.” Overall, we rate New Blaze as Questionable based on promotion of conspiracies and extreme right wing biased reporting. (M. Huitsing 9/5/2017)

newsbreakshere.com.name: NewsBreaksHere
newsbreakshere.com.notes: NewsBreaksHere is an extreme right biased news and opinion website. Virtually every story on this source is questionable and often links to other questionable and/or highly biased news sources. NewsBreaksHere also has a website that is difficult to navigate due to obnoxious pop-up advertising that tries to redirect you to potentially unsafe websites. NBH is also listed as a fake news source according to Politifact. (D. Van Zandt 4/12/2017)

newschicken.com.name: News Chicken
newschicken.com.notes: News Chicken does not have an “about” page or “disclaimer” so it not possible to know the owners intent. Most articles contains videos that portray Muslims and immigrants in a negative light. News Chicken has a strong right wing bias in reporting through story choices and loaded words. According to Real or Satire this source is listed as Satire. In reviewing this site we found real news posted, but with an extreme bias. Some stories do appear to be fake or originate from satire websites, but because there isn’t a statement indicating this website is satire we are classifying it as Questionable, based on extreme right wing bias and negative portrayal of immigrants. (D. Van Zandt 5/16/2017)

newsfeedhunter.com.name: News Feed Hunter
newsfeedhunter.com.notes: NewsFeed Hunter is an extreme right wing fake news website. Virtually all of the stories are either fake or completely misleading. NewsFeed Hunter has a pants on fire claim from Politifact. This source reads like a satire website, but without an “about” page or a disclaimer we are assuming it is a fake news outlet. Newsfeed Hunter is also on Factcheck.org’s fake news list. (6/14/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/7/2017)

newsuptoday.com.name: News Up Today
newsuptoday.com.notes: News Up Today does not have an About page and therefore we cannot determine their mission or editor. Currently, their contact page, privacy policy, DMCA removal and disclaimer page has broken links. News Up Today publishes stories using sensational loaded words in their headlines such as “Chuck Schumer Just Caught On Tape Saying Something UNTHINKABLE About Trump” and articles linked to factually mixed sources such as the Daily Mail UK, which has a poor track record with fact checkers. In addition, most of the stories are posted by a nameless Admin such as: “FBI Paid $100K+ For Concocted Trump Dossier During Election; John McCain Helped Broker Classified Deal With Comey”. News Up Today also has a false claim according to a credible fact checker. News Up Today always demonstrates extreme right wing bias in reporting through publishing articles that always favor the right. Overall, we rate News Up Today a Questionable Source based on extreme right wing bias, promotion of propaganda, poor sourcing and a failed fact check. (M. Huitsing 9/16/2017)

newswars.com.name: NewsWars
newswars.com.notes: NewsWars is a news and opinion website by Infowars publisher and far-right conspiracy theorist Alex Jones, where he claims to be bringing “truth back to the media.” He’s infamously made false claims concerning the 2012 Sandy Hook massacre, and federal investigators said he inspired a gunman to open fire inside a Washington, D.C., pizzeria last year by touting unfounded allegations on his shows and websites about its supposed ties to former Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton and human trafficking.

newswithviews.com.name: News With Views
newswithviews.com.notes: News With Views has the tagline “Where reality shatters illusion.”  The irony of this is not lost as this is a strongly right wing news and opinion site that is not shy about conspiracy theories. There is more illusion than reality found here. (D. Van Zandt 11/12/2016)

nmws.us.name: NMWS.us
nmws.us.notes: NMWS.us is a news and opinion website with an extreme left bias in reporting. Almost all articles favor the left and are anti-right. There is significant use of loaded words in headlines and many articles are sourced to left wing sites or not at all. NMWS also promotes conspiracy theories and pseudoscience in there rejection of the science of GMO’s. Further, this website does not have an about page to describe their mission or who runs/authors the website. They also set up articles in sections so the reader must click to load another page to continue reading in order generate more ad impressions. Overall, this is an extreme left biased source, that promotes conspiracies and pseudoscience. (D. Van Zandt 9/16/2017)

noscomunicamos.com.name: Nos Comunicamos
noscomunicamos.com.notes: Nos Comunicamos claims to be a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy.  However, the content of its news stories consist of extreme right wing bias, Islamophobia, and tired conspiracy theories. (8/20/2016)

oathkeepers.org.name: Oath Keepers
oathkeepers.org.notes: Oath Keepers is a far-right, anti-government American organization associated with the patriot and militia movements. The group describes itself as a non-partisan association of current and former military, police, and first responders, who pledge to fulfill the oath that all military and police take in order to “defend the Constitution against all enemies, foreign and domestic.” Several groups that monitor domestic terrorism and hate groups describe the Oath Keepers as extremist or radical. The Anti-Defamation League (ADL) describes the group as “heavily armed extremists with a conspiratorial and anti-government mindset looking for potential showdowns with the government.” The Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC) lists the group’s founder as a known extremist and describes his announced plans to create localized militia units as “frightening”. According to the SPLC, the group espouses a number of conspiracy and legal theories associated with the sovereign citizen movement and the white supremacist posse comitatus movement. SPLC senior fellow Mark Potok describes the group as a whole as “really just an anti-government group who believe in a wild set of conspiracy theories.”

onlineconservativepress.com.name: Online Conservative Press
onlineconservativepress.com.notes: Online Conservative Press present news and opinions with an extreme conservative right wing bias and numerous conspiracy theories that are not based on evidence. Promotes right wing based propaganda. (D. Van Zandt 8/14/2016)

openmagazines.com.name: Open Magazines
openmagazines.com.notes: Open Magazines is another Macedonia hosted Pro-Trump website. They have an extreme right wing bias in reporting and often are not factual. Open Magazines is also on Politifact’s fake news list. Overall, they are a questionable source for extreme right wing bias and publishing of fake news stories. (D. Van Zandt 6/6/2017)

oppositionreport.com.name: Opposition Report
oppositionreport.com.notes:
History
Opposition Report is a liberal news and opinion website that does not have an about page. A Whois search reveals the domain was purchased in February 2017.
Funded by / Ownership
The Whois search reveals that the website is owned by Addicting Info, a popular left biased news and information website. The website appears to be funded primarily through online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
In review, Opposition Report is a far left news and opinion website. Opposition Report frequently uses sensational headlines with loaded words such as this: TRUMP’S DEPORTATION FORCE HITS THE MILITARY; THIS IS HORRIFIC (VIDEO). In general, all stories favor the left and denigrate the right. While most information is sourced, some are sourced to factually mixed media such as Addicting Info. A factual search also reveals that Opposition Report has made a questionable claim in the past as well as an outright false claim.
Overall, we rate Opposition Report Questionable based on Extreme Left Wing Bias, promotion of propaganda and publication of misleading and false claims. (5/13/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/6/2018)

oureyeonislam.com.name: Our Eye on Islam
oureyeonislam.com.notes: Our Eye On Islam (OEOI) is an extreme right wing anti Islamic site packaging conspiracies and wildly distorted facts as “news”. There are no source links for their stories, and no byline credit for the authors except OEOI itself. There is no pretense of impartiality on OEOI, and their stories are really just a collection of the rehashed, heavily biased rhetoric, intentionally misleading and  misinterpreted “facts”, and outright fake news you typically find touted as “truth” on this type of site.

overpassesforamerica.com.name: Overpasses for America
overpassesforamerica.com.notes: Overpasses for America is not a website about infrastructure. It is an extreme right wing news and opinion website. OFA is not well sourced to factual content and uses sensational headlines. Here is one of Overpasses for America’s many false claims. In other words it is a low quality propaganda website. (D. Van Zandt 3/11/2017)

pacificpundit.com.name: Pacific Pundit
pacificpundit.com.notes: Pacific Pundit, like most questionable news sources does not provide an about page to describe their mission or ownership. In review, Pacific Pundit exhibits extreme right wing bias through wording and story selection that always favors the far right. For example, this headline: NFL THUGS WHO DISRESPECTED THE NATIONAL ANTHEM IN WEEK 7 uses a derogatory racial term to describe protesters of inequality and police violence. Pacific Pundit also does not source to credible media, for example they use Infowars: “CRAZY LEFTISTS PLAN ‘SCREAM HELPLESSLY AT THE SKY’ EVENT” and Blacksphere: “MAJOR DNC SHAKEUP – MEDIA SILENT.” Overall, Pacific Pundit is a questionable source based on extreme right wing bias, promotion of propaganda/conspiracy and use of sources that publish fake news. (M. Huitsing 10/23/2017)

patriotbeacon.com.name: Patriot Beacon
patriotbeacon.com.notes: The Patriot Beacon is a news and opinion website with extreme right wing bias in reporting. Every story is pro-right and anti-left. The Patriot Beacon uses strong loaded emotional words in both headlines and articles. Sourcing is often poor, leading to such sources as conspiracy website Zerohedge, and far right sources such as Judicial Watch and Young Conservatives. The Patriot Beacon has also failed a fact check. Overall, we rate the Patriot Beacon Questionable due to extreme right wing bias, a failed fact check and poor sourcing. (D. Van Zandt 8/8/2017)

patriotbeat.com.name: Patriot Beat
patriotbeat.com.notes:
History
Founded in 2017, Patriot Beat is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website that does not have an about page nor disclose ownership. In fact, we could not find any names at all associated with this website (Red Flag).
Funded by / Ownership
Again, Patriot Beat provides zero information related to ownership and domain registration is private. The website is funded through online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
In review, Patriot Beat always uses strong excessive loaded language in their headlines such as this: Obama’s Cronies Showed Their TRUE Anti-American Colors With THIS Outrageous Move. This particular article is essentially a republish of an article from the Questionable Conservative Tribune, which has failed numerous fact checks. All stories published favor the right and denigrate the left. Patriot Beat generally republishes stories from Mixed factual sources such as the Daily Caller and questionable sources such as Breitbart and Big League Politics.
Overall, we rate Patriot Beat, Questionable based on extreme right wing bias, promotion of propaganda and use of poor sources. (5/13/2018) Updated (D. Van Zandt 1/2/2019)

patribotics.blog.name: Patribotics Blog
patribotics.blog.notes: Patribotics is a blog written by Louise Mensch who is a former conservative British MP and co-founder of the Heat Street website. The purpose of the Patribotics blog, according to their about page is to provide “investigative journalism and analysis of the Russian hack on America’s election and related topics. Pro-America, pro-democracy, pro-NATO, pro-Russia, anti-Putin.” While Patribotics does produce factual content, they also promote numerous unproven conspiracies. The blog has been called controversial and cites unnamed sources in the intelligence community. Mensch has stated that she prefers the freedom of self-publishing, which having her own blog affords; she told The Guardian, “I didn’t want to be subject to an editing process. Editors would ask: who are your sources? And I can’t tell them.”  Overall, this source does produce some quality investigative journalism, but there are also many unproven and un-sourced claims that render this blog questionable. (D. Van Zandt 7/30/2017)

patriotfires.com.name: Patriot Fires
patriotfires.com.notes: Patriot Fires is an extreme right biased news and opinion website. There is very little factual information and all headlines are sensationalized. For example, there is an article claiming that Michelle Obama attempted to register to run for President in 2020, but was denied. First, she never attempted to register for a Presidential run and has routinely claimed over and over that she is not ever going to run for President. This is a propaganda site. (D. Van Zandt 3/11/2017)

patriothangout.com.name: Patriot Hangout
patriothangout.com.notes: The Patriot Hangout is a news and opinion blog that is about as far right as it can get. Virtually every story on this website is either propaganda or flat out fake news. For example, in just scanning the first few articles today there is a story about Obama’s “Mass Slaughter of Bald Eagles“, “Obama and Hillary facing 30 years in Prison“, “Democrats links to Justice Scalia’s Death“, etc. Patriot Hangout is also listed on Factcheck.org’s fake news list. (4/17/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/7/2017)

patriotupdate.com.name: Patriot Update
patriotupdate.com.notes: Patriot Update contains over the top right wing conspiracies and propaganda. Patriot Update mostly does not source and when they do it is to other extreme right wing sites. They also post stories that lack evidence such as this one: MUSLIM IMMIGRANT RAPES AND STRANGLES ELDERLY WOMAN AFTER CHURCH. In this article there is zero evidence the person who committed the crime is Muslim. He simply is an immigrant from Morocco. Further, the source for this story is Pam Geller, who is an Anti-immigrant activist and consistently rails against Islam. (8/18/2016) Update (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

patrioticviralnews.com.name: Patriotic Viral News
patrioticviralnews.com.notes: Patriotic Viral News is a news and opinion blog that uses video clips in their articles. This source only publishes right wing content that leans heavily on propaganda. Many of the videos come from unreliable sources such as Rush Limbaugh. (D. Van Zandt 3/1/2017)

patriotsvoice.info.name: Patriots Voice
patriotsvoice.info.notes: Patriots Voice is a news website with extreme right wing bias and without an about page.

personalliberty.com.name: Personal Liberty
personalliberty.com.notes: Personal Liberty is an ultra conservative source with over the top bias.  Routinely publishes conspiracies and pseudoscience information. This source could easily be classified in the Conspiracy-Pseudoscience category. However, it has more of a political bias through the publishing of right wing propaganda. (D. Van Zandt 6/19/2016)

plymouthpatriotpost.com.name: Plymouth Patriot Post
plymouthpatriotpost.com.notes: The Plymouth Patriot Post is news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. Almost all news is curated from other sources. Many times news is linked to credible sources, however the headlines are often highly sensationalized and do not match the more neutral content of the article. Other times news is linked to far right or conspiracy websites. There is credible news on this website, it is just hard to locate with the click bait sensational headlines. (D. Van Zandt 5/19/2017)

pmnightlynews.com.name: PM Nightly News
pmnightlynews.com.notes: PM Nightly News is a conservative news website that promotes conspiracies and also has questionable science news.  In reviewing this site the first story pulled up was a false conspiracy regarding the Clinton Foundation.  Not trustworthy. (D. Van Zandt 10/26/2016)

timespolice.com.name: Police Times
timespolice.com.notes: Police Times is an extreme right wing biased blog that strongly favors the 2nd amendment and publishes fake news. Police Times does not have an about page, disclaimer or names of any person behind the site. A whois search reveals that the owner of the site may be located in Great Britain. All articles utilize very strong loaded words that favor the right and denigrate the left. While sources vary, the most commonly used source is the Questionable Mad World News, which is also on Politifacts fake news list. Further, Police Times have published completely fake news such as this: 2 Million Rounds Of Ammo That ‘Went Missing’ Under Obama Turns Up In Enemy Hands. Unfortunately, this is an entirely fake news story. Without any author information, publishing fake news, and linking to a known fake news website, we rate Police Times Questionable. (D. Van Zandt 12/06/2017)

politicalears.com.name: Political Ears
politicalears.com.notes: Political ears is an extreme right wing site that publishes mostly fake news and/or is simply poorly sourced.  Either way the content is far right and not credible. (D. Van Zandt 11/5/2016)

politicalinbox.com.name: Political Inbox
politicalinbox.com.notes: Political Inbox is an extreme left biased news and opinion blog. Every article is sensationalized and contains highly emotional loaded words that always favor the left and opposes the right. Here is an example of a typical headline: Trump Tuesday Night Rage – Tweets Like A Total PSYCHO. I did not perform a thorough review of this website due to excessive pop-up advertising that made the website difficult to navigate. Further, many of the ads were not appropriate for all ages. This is an extreme left biased propaganda website that is trying to serve up clickbait articles to increase advertising views. Not a credible news source. (D. Van Zandt 7/19/2017)

politicalmayhem.news.name: Political Mayhem News
politicalmayhem.news.notes: Political Mayhem News is an extreme right news and opinion blog/website. All stories favor the right through loaded emotional language and topic selection that always favors the right. There is significant use of loaded language to favor the right such as: “BREAKING: Senate Takes First Step To Punish Obama For His Role In Russian Nuclear Bribery Case.” This article also links directly to the most famous conspiracy source Alex Jones and InfoWars. Overall, we rate Political Mayhem as a Questionable source based on extreme right wing bias (propaganda) and sourcing to known conspiracy websites such as Infowars. (D. Van Zandt 12/18/2017)

politicalsitenews.com.name: Political Site News
politicalsitenews.com.notes: Political Site News is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. All headlines and content uses strong loaded words that favor the right and denigrates the left. In the last week this source has published two fake news stories. The first fake news story involves Malia Obama being arrested for Marijuana. She wasn’t. The next fake story is how the cop who arrested her was found dead. He wasn’t. Since Political Site News does not have an about page or disclaimer to indicate they are satire, we will just have to assume this is a fake right wing news site. (D. Van Zandt 8/17/17)

politicoinfo.com.name: Politico Info
politicoinfo.com.notes: Politico Info is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. It is not affiliated with the large mainstream Politico website. Politico Info uses sensational headlines that do not match the story. For example, on this story “What Hillary Clinton Did IMMEDIATELY After Comey Was Fired Will Make You SICK” does not actually say what Clinton did. It displays a bunch tweets from other people and injects biased commentary into the article. Essentially, this is a typical extreme conservative site that shuns factual reporting in favor of propaganda. We also don’t recommend visiting this website unless you want to be bombarded with pop-up ads. (D. Van Zandt 5/10/2017)

politicslive.net.name: Politics Live
politicslive.net.notes: Politics Live is a news and opinion website with extreme right wing bias in reporting as all stories favor the right and denigrate the left. Politics Live also routinely publishes fake news such as: “BREAKING: Raiders Suspend Marshawn Lynch For MASSIVE Disrespect During Anthem.” This story is 100% false as Lynch was suspended for one game due to an on field altercation and not related to his protest. In another story they use a loaded ridiculous headline that is also 100% fake: “CONFIRMED: Barack Obama And Corey Booker Threw A ‘ Christmas Crack Ho’ Party On Capitol Hill.” Since Politics Live does not have an about page or disclaimer indicating this is a satire website, we must assume it is simply a Questionable extreme right fake news site. (D. Van Zandt 1/15/2018)

politifact.news.name: Politifact News
politifact.news.notes: Politifact News (Politifact.news) should not ever be confused with the credible Politifact from the Tampa Bay Times. Politifact News is an extreme right biased and conspiracy website that publishes only news that is against the real Politifact. They use the Good Gopher Network of alternative sources to aggregate their news. The sources that appear on this website are Natural News, The Gateway Pundit, Breitbart and CNS News, just to name a few. Each of these is either a conspiracy, questionable or far right website. This is a Questionable website based on the very poor sources they use to discredit Politifact. (D. Van Zandt 8/23/2017)

powderedwigsociety.com.name: Powdered Wig Society
powderedwigsociety.com.notes:
History
Founded in 2013, by Tony Blasioli, The Powdered Wig Society “draws its name from John Trumbull’s painting, Declaration of Independence, which depicts Mr. Jefferson and his five-man drafting committee presenting their work to Congress. The painting can be found on the back of the U.S. $2 bill. The original, which is 12′ x 18′, hangs in the US Capitol rotunda. It’s our hope that our representatives, who walk by this painting regularly, come to fully understand its significance.” The domain is registered in Hawaii.
Funded by / Ownership
Although the website does not disclose ownership we gather it is owned by Tony Blasioli (not confirmed) and is funded through online advertising. 
Analysis / Bias
The Powdered Wig Society is a news and opinion blog with extreme right wing bias in reporting. All articles favor the right and use strong emotional loaded words. The Powdered Wig Society does attempt to source their information, however most of the time it is to right wing or other questionable sources. Further, the Powdered Wig Society has a terrible track record with fact checkers, with numerous false claims. 
A factual search reveals many failed fact checks from IFCN fact checkers.
Overall, this source does publish some credible news, however it is always extremely right biased. Based on extreme bias, promotion of propaganda and poor fact checking we rate the Powdered Wig Society as Questionable. (D. Van Zandt 8/1/2017) Updated (12/7/2018)

president45donaldtrump.com.name: President 45 Donald Trump
president45donaldtrump.com.notes: President 45 Donald Trump is an extreme right wing biased news blog. This source also dabbles in conspiracy theories such as Chemtrails. According to Politifact this is a fake news source. Factcheck.org also lists them as fake news site. We rate it questionable based on conspiracy promotion and extreme right wing bias in reporting and wording. (6/16/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/7/2017)

prideof-america.org.name: Prideof-America.org (American News)
prideof-america.org.notes: There are many domains that point to a website called American News. All of them are Extreme Right fake news sites. Prideof-America (American News) displays sensational headlines that always favor the right. Prideof-America also consistently fails fact checks and promotes right wing conspiracies. Further, Prideof-America is listed on Factcheck.org’s fake news list. Essentially, Prideof-America (American News) is a fake news website that is established to create clickbait headlines to increase advertising revenue. Therefore, due to extreme right wing bias and the publishing of fake news we rate Prideof-America (American News) as a questionable source. (D. Van Zandt 1/6/2018)

prntly.com.name: Prntly
prntly.com.notes: Prntly is a politically conservative American website.  It was described by Snopes as “a disreputable outlet that has a penchant for publishing both fake news and spurious pro-Trump articles.”  This website could also be classified as satire or conspiracy. Prntly is considered a fake news website according to Politifact. (D. Van Zandt 10/6/2016)

proamericanews.com.name: Pro-America News
proamericanews.com.notes: Pro-America News is a news and opinion website with an extreme right bias in reporting. There is irony in the name of this site as they appear to hate everything about America. Overall, this is an extreme right wing biased website and does not shy away from conspiracy theories, especially if it involves anyone even a degree left of center. (10/24/2016) Update (D. Van Zandt 9/3/2017)

progresstribune.com.name: Progress Tribune
progresstribune.com.notes: Progress Tribune is an independent news aggregation website with an extreme left bias. Virtually every headline uses loaded words as does the content of articles. Some articles do not list a source. Progress Tribune also does not list who their ownership is or a mission statement. Some of the articles published come from Questionable sources such as Viral Title and factually mixed sources such as Shareblue. Essentially, this a far left wing website that always favors the left. This is a propaganda site. (3/22/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 2/9/2018)

progressivestoday.com.name: Progressives Today
progressivestoday.com.notes: Don’t let the name fool you.  Progressives Today is an extreme right wing conservative site through story selection and use of extreme loaded words. This is not a credible news source. (D. Van Zandt 10/21/2016)

projectpurge.com.name: Project Purge
projectpurge.com.notes: Project Purge is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. All articles on the website are pro-right and anti-left. Many stories on the website are not just factually wrong, but offensive toward Minorities, Muslims and liberals.  Project Purge is also extremely pro-Christian and regularly publishes articles that defame Islam. This source also has a category of news called “social cancer” in which they publish negative news stories about Minorities and Muslims and how it apparently negatively affects white people. While we cannot find any groups such as the Southern Poverty Law Center, classifying this website as a hate group, it certainly does publish material that is racially questionable at best. Based on an extreme right wing bias in reporting, promotion of propaganda and questionable hate speech, we rate this source Questionable. (D. Van Zandt 7/27/2017)

proudcons.com.name: The Proud Conservative
proudcons.com.notes: The Proud Conservative presents news with an extreme right wing bias.  Publishes information that can be false. (11/15/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

proudleader.com.name: Proud Leader
proudleader.com.notes: Proud Leader is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right bias. Basically, this is a fake news site. Virtually every story is either fake, unproven or misleading. This site is not worth the effort to write much. Here is a Pants on Fire claim to show their work. They are also on Politifact’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 4/13/2017)

proud-patriots.com.name: Proud Patriots
proud-patriots.com.notes: Proud Patriots is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website.  It does a poor job of sourcing information (if at all) and does not shy from conspiracies. They also use very sensational headlines and loaded words throughout articles. They have been accused of promoting a fake news story according to Poynter. (D. Van Zandt 11/28/2016)

puppetstringnews.com.name: Puppet String News
puppetstringnews.com.notes:
History
Puppet String News is a blog with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. The site describes itself on their about page as “Puppet String News was created by a US NAVY vet, who served four years in the military, got out because he was tired of the world and its current state. Decided to get into alternative news to tell the truth to best of ability.” On can argue if the mission is successful.
Funded by / Ownership
The website does not openly disclose ownership, though it appears to be the personal blog of an anonymous person, who derives funding through online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
In review, Puppet String News publishes stories with sensational headlines such as: ”President Trump finally grabbed a pussy yesterday” and they use loaded words both in their headlines and the articles. Further, the articles are poorly sourced. Puppet String News also publishes conspiracy theories such as “Seth Rich murder connection, John Podesta ex sister-in-law is on DC Police board” 
On 10/2/2017 there was a mass shooting in Las Vegas that has been called the worst in USA history. Over the course of a few hours Puppet String News reported without verification that Antifa was behind the shooting, then ISIS and finally they concluded that it was an act of mind control through MK Ultra and the Deep State.
Puppet String News does not have a positive track record with fact checkers.
Overall, Puppet String News could be rated as a conspiracy website, but due to extreme right wing bias we simply rate them a questionable source due to promotion of unverified claims and strong right wing propaganda. (M. Huitsing 10/2/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 8/24/2018)

qpolitical.com.name: QPolitical
qpolitical.com.notes: QPolitical is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. Uses strong loaded words, promotes propaganda and does not always source to credible information. Has a very poor fact checking record. (D. Van Zandt 2/11/2017)

react365.com.name: React 365
react365.com.notes: React 365 is a service that allows people to create their own fake stories with the react365.com domain name. Everything from React 365 is fake news. (D. Van Zandt 11/16/2016)

readconservatives.news.name: Read Conservatives
readconservatives.news.notes: Read Conservatives is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website. Most articles contain highly sensationalized headlines and reports. All stories favor the right and denigrate the left. This source also appears on Politifact’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 6/16/2017)

reagancoalition.com.name: Reagan Coalition
reagancoalition.com.notes: The Reagan Coalition is an extreme right wing news websites that is mostly factually inaccurate and is listed as a fake news source on Fake News Checker.  We are pretty sure Reagan would not want his name associated with this website. (D. Van Zandt 10/26/2016)

realtimepolitics.com.name: Real Time Politics
realtimepolitics.com.notes: Real Time Politics is a news and opinion website with extreme left wing bias.  They use over-the-top sensational headlines and use of loaded words in articles. RTP is loose on facts and publishes common left wing conspiracies against conservatives.  They have a poor track record with fact checkers. This is a classic clickbait propaganda site that is not trustworthy. (10/2/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/1/2017)

redcountry.us.name: Red Country – Conservative News
redcountry.us.notes: Red Country is an extreme right wing news and opinion website. Red Country promotes anti-Muslim propaganda and publishes ridiculous news that in many cases is just fake. This source also does not source to credible information. Has a Pants on Fire rating from Politifact due to publishing a fake photo of President Obama in handcuffs. It also is on Politifact’s fake news list. (3/15/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

redice.tv.name: Red Ice TV
redice.tv.notes:
History
Founded in 2003, Red Ice TV’s tagline “The future is the past” is a news platform that consists of a website, TV and online radio, including Red Ice Radio and Radio 3Fourteen run by Henrik Palmgren, who is a Swedish alt-right political vlogger. His program frequently hosts a wide variety of content, including white nationalism, antisemitic theories, the paranormal, and philosophy, frequently from a far-right perspective. Guests on the show include white nationalists such as Richard B. Spencer and Andrew Anglin (owner and founder of the Daily Stormer).
Funded By / Ownership
The website appears to be owned by Palmgren and is supported through subscriptions and pay per view.
Analysis / Bias
In review, the website content contains strong anti-Muslim propaganda that showcases crimes committed by Muslims, while failing to report crimes by whites. The Southern Poverty Law Center calls Red Ice TV “a racist online radio broadcast.” Red Ice TV also interviews people who are conspiracy theorists such as L.A. Marzulli who has a false claim according to Snopes. 
In summary we rate this a Questionable source based on an extreme alt-right bias that promotes white nationalist propaganda, conspiracy theories and is considered a hate group by the SPLC. (M. Huitsing 8/24/2017)
Special Note: We provide a link below to their website for the purpose of our Chrome Extensions, which requires a link to the website in order to display on Facebook and the Chrome task bar. We recommend not clicking the link. (D. Van Zandt)

redinfo.us.name: Red Info
redinfo.us.notes:
History
Red Info is an extreme right wing fake news site that originates from Veles, Macedonia.
Funded by / Ownership
According to Whois the website is registered to Marko Cvetkovski. The website does not have advertising or a donation link.
Analysis / Bias 
In review, all stories are either outright fake or simply misleading. There is a reason for this source to be on Politifact’s fake news list. Red Info typically utilizes loaded headlines that favor the right such as this: Mike Huckabee Just Exposed Dirty Secret Behind Dem’s SCOTUS Hypocrisy. Further, most stories are not sourced at all.
A factual search reveals numerous failed fact checks from IFCN fact checkers.
Overall, we rate Red Info Questionable based on extreme right wing bias and the publishing of fake right wing news stories. (7/16/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/24/2018)

redpeople.us.name: Red People
redpeople.us.notes:
History
Red People is an extreme right news website that does not have an about page. A Whois search reveals the domain was purchased/renewed in June of 2018 and hails from the fake news capitol of the world Veles, Macedonia.
Funded by / Ownership
According to Whois the domain is owned by Marko Cvetkovski from Veles, Macedonia and is funded through online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
In review, Red People is a typical extreme right fake news website from Macedonia. A sample article reads like this: “Massive Muslim Terror Network just Discovered in Chicago after Cops get Clue about what they were Hiding.” This story then sources another questionable website called the Conservative Daily Post, which does not even mention a terror network. The whole story is about a Muslim business owner who was selling cigarettes illegally and then Red People giving the opinion that he is funneling money to terrorist groups without evidence. This is a fake news website with virtually every article favoring President Trump.
Overall, we rate Red People Questionable based on the publication of extreme right fake news. (4/12/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 9/8/2018)

redpolitics.us.name: Red Politics
redpolitics.us.notes: Red Politics is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. Every article favors the right and disparages the left. There is significant use of loaded words in both the headlines and articles. According to their About Page the reader should beware that they may post satire or fake news. Red Politics has a history of posting fake news. You can view an example here. Overall, Red Politics is an extreme right wing biased propaganda site that sometimes publishes fake news.

redrocktribune.com.name: Red Rock Daily News
redrocktribune.com.notes: Red Rock Daily News is an extreme right wing site which repackages and reprints conspiracies and anti-Obama, Clinton, and Islamic rhetoric from a number of questionable sources. Operating as both Red Rock Daily News under the http://www.redrocktribune.com/ link and Red Rock Tribune under the http://rrtribune.com/ link. Both sites are similar in content, and what sourcing is included in the stories are invariably linked to other right wing and conspiracy sites. Due to the blatant right wing bias and lack of credible sourcing Red Rock Daily News is rated Questionable. (11/25/2016) Updated (D. Kelley 9/1/2017)

rrtribune.com.name: Red Rock Tribune
rrtribune.com.notes: Red Rock Tribune is an extreme right wing site which repackages and reprints conspiracies and anti-Obama, Clinton, and Islamic rhetoric from a number of questionable sources. Operating as both Red Rock Daily News under the http://www.redrocktribune.com/ link and Red Rock Tribune under the http://rrtribune.com/ link. Both sites are similar in content, and what sourcing is included in the stories are invariably linked to other right wing and conspiracy sites. Due to the blatant right wing bias and lack of credible sourcing Red Rock Tribune is rated Questionable. (D. Kelley 9/1/2017)

redstatejournalist.com.name: Red State Journalist
redstatejournalist.com.notes: Red State Journalist has an about page, but does not list who is maintaining the website. They state their mission as: “The idea behind RED STATE JOURNALIST is to be a centralized portal that brings the news on the US President decisions on a daily basis.” Their contact page appears to be a broken link at this time. They publish news stories under the following categories: Uncategorized, USA POLITICS, NEWS, and CRIME. Red State Journalist also has a FAQ section that mentions questions that are unrelated to a news website:

redstatepundit.com.name: Red State Pundit
redstatepundit.com.notes: Red State Pundit is a news and opinion website with an overt right wing bias. They present information with loaded words and not all stories are sourced to credible information, in fact most link to questionable sources, such as the Conservative Tribune. Red State Pundit promotes right wing conspiracies such as “Malik Obama Tweets Photo of Brother Barack’s Kenyan “Certificate of Birth”. Due to extreme right wing bias and sourcing to questionable news sources we rate Red State Pundit as Questionable. (M. Huitsing 8/27/2017)

redwhiteandright.com.name: Red, White and Right
redwhiteandright.com.notes: Red, White and Right is an extreme right biased news and opinion blog. RWR uses strong loaded language in headlines and in the body of articles. They rarely source to outside media and when they do, it usually is on our questionable list. The first article on the page today is about how Obama denies his “Whiteness”, which is ironic as they also call white privilege a myth in the same article. This article is written from the perspective of white privilege from beginning to end. This is not a credible news source. (D. Van Zandt 4/9/2017)

renewamerica.com.name: Renew America
renewamerica.com.notes: Renew America is an extreme right Christian New and opinion website. According to their about page: “Renew America is a grassroots organization that supports the self-evident truths found in the Declaration of Independence, and their faithful application through upholding the U.S. Constitution, as written. Its purpose is to thoughtfully and courageously advance the cause of our nation’s Founders.”

resistancereport.com.name: Resistance Report
resistancereport.com.notes: Resistance Report is a news and opinion blog/website with an extreme left wing bias. Headlines contain loaded words and are sensational. News reporting is also filled with emotional language that favors the left. Most articles are sourced, but many are sourced to far left or questionable sources. Resistance Report also has a Pants on Fire rating from Politifact. (D. Van Zandt 4/15/2017)

returnofkings.com.name: Return of Kings
returnofkings.com.notes: Return of Kings is run by Daryush Valizadeh (known by his Internet alias Roosh Vörek or Roosh V) who is an American manosphere denizen, misogynist, rape apologist, pick-up artist, and sex tourist.  We suggest you take a look at RationalWiki’s write up on Roosh V for more information. (D. Van Zandt 3/9/2017)

rightalerts.com.name: Right Alerts
rightalerts.com.notes: Right Alerts is a news and opinion website with the tagline “ Breaking news Without the Liberal Bias.” With that said, almost every article favors the right and denigrates the left. Generally, articles have highly emotional headlines such as “Sebastian Gorka’s Chilling Explanation Why He Resigned from Trump Administration.” The articles on Right Alert typically consist of a couple of editorial sentences followed by large quotations from other sources. Right Alerts presents information with loaded words and not all stories are sourced to credible information. In this particular article they source Pamela Geller who has a poor track record with fact checkers and has been named as an Anti-Islam source. Overall, due to extreme right wing bias and poor sourcing we rate Right Alerts as a Questionable source. (M. Huitsing 8/27/2017)

rightjournalist.com.name: Right Journalist
rightjournalist.com.notes: Right Journalist is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. Right Journalist uses loaded words and sensational headlines. They also source to highly questionable sources such as Mr. Conservative and Rush Limbaugh who has failed numerous fact checks. A source that links to questionable sources, is therefore questionable. (D. Van Zandt 4/8/2017)

rightsmarts.com.name: Right Smarts
rightsmarts.com.notes: Right Smarts is a blog/website with an extreme right wing bias. They use loaded words in headlines and sometimes source to other far right or questionable sources. A typical headline looks like this: Dear Trump Haters: When Your Cause Is Being Lead By A Terrorist, Maybe It’s Time To Think Things Over, in other words it is pretty biased and loaded.(D. Van Zandt 2/28/2017)

rinf.com.name: RINF
rinf.com.notes: Launched in 2004, RINF is an alternative news, citizen journalism website that focuses on producing television shows, films and publishing conspiracy theories such as “’9/11 was an inside job, yes it was’, organised by the American government and Hollywood”. RINF is based in Lancaster, United Kingdom and Mick Meaney is the CEO.

ruthinstitute.org.name: Ruth Institute
ruthinstitute.org.notes: According to their about page “The Ruth Institute is a global non-profit organization creating a mass social movement to end family breakdown, by energizing the Survivors of the Sexual Revolution. We especially focus on the impact of family breakdown on children: understanding it, healing it, ending it.” The founder is Dr. Jennifer Roback Morse.

sharednewsreport.com.name: Shared News Report
sharednewsreport.com.notes: On their about page, Shared News Report does not indicate who owns or edits the website content, however they describe their mission as ”Shared News Report is a leading political and world current affairs website. The website has always encouraged independent views, and never encouraged any party’s agenda.”

shtfplan.com.name: SHTFplan.com
shtfplan.com.notes: SHTFplan.com is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. While many stories are factual on SHTF, some are highly questionable. For example, there are many instances on the website where SHTF subscribes to the New World Order conspiracy. In other cases, they routinely use loaded language to describe African Americans. Overall, this source amounts to a right wing propaganda site. (D. Van Zandt 5/4/2017)

smoloko.com.name: Smoloko News
smoloko.com.notes: Smoloko News is an independent, alt-right Jewish conspiracy website and “news” organization founded and run by Youngstown, Ohio native Scottie Spencer. Smoloko News promotes hate and Anti-Semitic rhetoric such as “BAN THE PARASITIC JEWISH GROUP AND SAVE HUMANITY” Smoloko also promotes hatred for Muslims, LGBTQ, Feminists, Catholics and pretty much anyone else who is not a straight WASP male. However, their hatred for Jews is the top priority of this website. Overall, we rate Smoloko News as an extreme right hate group. There is a link provided for this website, but it really is not worth clicking on. (M. Huitsing 8/31/2017)

southafricatoday.net.name: South Africa Today
southafricatoday.net.notes: South Africa Today (SAT) News is an English news and information distributor. The main aim of South Africa Today is exposure of South African news. South Africa Today also covers regional African news. South Africa Today does not have about page, therefore the editor is unknown at this time.

speakgov.com.name: SpeakGov.com
speakgov.com.notes: SpeakGov.com describes itself as a blog dedicated to give every political view a platform. The site has a forum section also, but has only 1 post. The site’s blog section seems to have only bloggers with strong right wing bias that use loaded language without any sources at all such as The Leftist Media Coup et Detat. In other cases the bloggers are sourcing far right sources or outright questionable sources such as the Gateway Pundit, which has a horrible record with fact checkers. Although there are a few bloggers posting information from the left, the majority is far right. Therefore, we rate SpeakGov.com questionable based on extreme right bias of the bloggers and use of poor sourcing. (M. Huitsing 8/17/2017)

southjerseymechanic.com.name: South Jersey Mechanic (Trump News)
southjerseymechanic.com.notes: The South Jersey Mechanic is billed as Trump News.  The website is horribly designed and simply would not work in Chrome.  It did however load on Internet Explorer.  Regardless, this is an extreme right biased site that curates news from different sources.  Not surprisingly all news is Pro-Trump.  Many of those sources come straight from our conspiracy category. Highly untrustworthy source. (D. Van Zandt 12/8/2016)

speisa.com.name: Speisa
speisa.com.notes: Speisa is a website that publishes sensational stories. The owner/editor of the website is unknown. According to their about page Speisa describes its content as “posts are not satire, as lots of real, really strange stuff are happening in this strange world. Some news are funny, some are sad, and some are plain horrific.”

spinzon.com.name: Spinzon
spinzon.com.notes: Spinzon is a far right conservative news and opinion blog. All headlines and articles are sensationalized with loaded words favoring conservatives and against liberals. There is zero balance or presentation of both sides. This source is also on Politifact’s fake news list. We rate this source questionable based on extreme bias and failed fact checks. (6/17/2017)

sputniknews.com.name: Sputnik News
sputniknews.com.notes:
History
Sputnik is a Russian news agency and radio broadcaster which publishes online stories and radio shows, as well as videos. In 2013, via a presidential decree by Vladimir Putin, the radio station Voice of Russia and RIA Novosti news service was abolished and replaced by Rossiya Segodnya (Russia Today, not to be confused with RT). In 2014, Rossiya Segodnya (Russia Today) launched Sputnik and conservative news anchor, Dmitry Kiselyov was appointed as Director General of Rossiya Segodnya. Kiselyov is known for ultra conservative views and anti-gay comments.
According to their about page, Sputnik describes itself as “The agency covers global political and economic news targeting an international audience.” Sputnik is based in Moscow. 
Funded by / Ownership
Sputnik is owned and funded by the Russian Government to promote Russia’s image abroad. The Sputnik news service produces over 1,500 news items daily and around the clock that are available to subscribers via the web terminal and mobile app. The website also serves online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
Sputnik is often accused of reporting ‘fake news, spreading misinformation and being a “Kremlin Propaganda Machine” by European and American media outlets. In 2017, the FBI launched an investigation into Sputnik for a potential violation of the Foreign Agents Registration Act (FARA).
In review, Sputnik’s coverage regarding American Politics leans right and is consistently pro-Trump: “FBI Memo Implies Dossier on Trump Russian Collusion Funded by Clinton.” Sputnik also frequently uses strongly loaded emotional wording in headlines such as this: “WATCH: Philly’s New Year Parade Act Sees Trump, Putin Fight Over ‘Pee Tape’”
Sputnik routinely publishes articles that promote conspiracy theories such as those about the murder of Seth Rich, which fact checker Snopes has debunked. Sputnik also employs conspiracy theorists such as former Breitbart writer Lee Stranahan, who was hired as co-host of a radio show for Sputnik Radio, called “Fault Lines with Nixon and Stranahan”. Lee Stranahan also appears as a guest on Alex Jones’ Infowars program, which is famous for promoting outrageous right-wing conspiracies.
When it comes to sourcing, Sputnik occasionally uses credible sources such as Reuters and CNN, however they also source to known conspiracy sites such as Infowars: “InfoWars Alex Jones Talks Brexit, Freedom of Speech in US, Political Correctness” and “Anonymous Exposes UK’s Hybrid Warfare Project”. Further, they frequently source to their own articles or they use large blocks of quotes.
According to Google Fact Check Explorer, Sputnik has a very poor fact check record with 17 misleading or false claims. Below is a small sampling of their many failed fact checks:




Sputnik Falsely Blames India’s Sell-Off of US Securities on ‘Weaponization of the Dollar’ – FALSE
Sputnik Falsely Accuses UN of Supporting the White Helmet Disinfo Campaign Sputnik, Itself, Spreads – FALSE
Sputnik and Zvezda Falsely Claim Hitler’s Mein Kampf is more popular than Harry Potter in Latvia – FALSE
Is the US Evacuating IS Members from Syria? – FALSE
Sputnik: Nevada Declared ‘State of Emergency’ Over Marijuana Shortage – FALSE




Overall, we rate Sputnik Questionable based on frequent promotion of conspiracies and pro-Russian propaganda, as well as use of poor sources and numerous failed fact checks. (7/19/2016) Updated (M. Huitsing 1/3/2019)

squawker.org.name: Squawker
squawker.org.notes: Squawker is a news and opinion website that claims to be a fact checker, especially of the mainstream media. In reality this is a website that promotes conspiracies with an extreme right bias. We have decided to classify this website as questionable versus a conspiracy-pseudoscience site due to the extreme political bias that always favors the right and discredits the left. An example of a conspiracy article is one entitled: Is Obama Plotting A Second Civil War? EX-Aide Says Yes, Obama Still Thinks He’s The President. There isn’t evidence that Obama is plotting anything or thinks he is still President. The primary source for this story is Dick Morris and Infowars. A conspiracy takes a story such as Obama holding meetings each day and opines a much more sinister plot. This is a classic example of conspiracy and also propaganda. In order to keep this short I will just summarize that this website is very anti-Islam and openly declares them an enemy. They also have a ridiculous article using skewed stats that show men are raped by women at an equal rate as women. Overall, this is an extreme right wing biased website that promotes propaganda and conspiracy. (D. Van Zandt 8/10/2017)

staresattheworld.com.name: Stares at the World
staresattheworld.com.notes: Stares at the World  is an Alt-Right blog founded by Davis M.J. Aurini. According his about page he studied history at McMaster University, he served as an Infantry soldier in the Canadian Forces and with his own words he is “a Scholar, Author, Film Maker, and a God fearing Catholic, who loves women for their illogical nature.” He also has bio with IMDB.

statefort.com.name: State Fort Daily
statefort.com.notes: State Fort Daily is a news blog that focuses on politics, sports and crime. According to their about page description “StateFort.com is a sports blog and is here to update you on the things that happen in U.S and worldwide on a daily basis.” According to Whois, State Fort Daily is based in Sofia, Macedonia. Macedonia is known as the Fake News capitol of the world.

stateofthenation2012.com.name: State of the Nation 2012
stateofthenation2012.com.notes: State of the Nation 2012 is a propaganda site that focuses on right wing politics.  Although debunked long ago this source continues to report on Pizzagate. They also report on the New World Order and other political conspiracies. State of the Nation 2012 does produce legitimate news among the conspiracies and propaganda. (D. Van Zandt 1/13/2017)

steadfastandloyal.com.name: Steadfast and Loyal
steadfastandloyal.com.notes: Steadfast and Loyal is an opinion and news website with a strong right wing bias in reporting. Steadfast and Loyal does not have an about page, therefore the ownership of the site is not known. Steadfast and Loyal use loaded words in their headlines and articles such as “LIBERALS LATEST CHICKEN LITTLE WARNING FAILS TO MATERIALIZE”. Although, they utilize credible right wing sources such as The American Spectator, they also use factually mixed sources such as Daily Caller and questionable sources such as Allen West Republic.  Example: “THE DEEP STATE IS COMING UNGLUED RIGHT BEFORE OUR EYES”. Further, Steadfast and Loyal made a false claim according to Snopes: “Vigilante Protesters Digging Up Confederate Graves after Charlottesville Clashes?”. Overall, we rate Steadfast and Loyal Questionable for factual reporting based on a failed fact check and the promotion of extreme right propaganda. (M. Huitsing 12/27/2017)

stonecoldtruth.com.name: Stone Cold Truth
stonecoldtruth.com.notes: Stone Cold Truth (SCT) is not a news site so much as a personal blog for Roger Stone. Mr. Stone is a conservative libertarian writer and political pundit, who bills himself as a “Legendary American Political Operative.” The stories on SCT are poorly sourced, marginally factual, and much of the writing borders on conspiracy. Additionally, many of the reference sources at the end of the stories, such as The Daily Caller, are listed as Right Biased or Questionable themselves. As with many extremely biased sites on both the left and the right, many of the facts presented in the stories are either taken out of context or misrepresented.

studionewsnetwork.com.name: Studio News Network
studionewsnetwork.com.notes: Studio News Network is a conservative news source/blog that reports validated independent news stories (VIN’s) on government corruption and in particular police brutality and injustice.
