The website was founded by Jon Masters (Jonathan Spiel) who states on his about page: “One of the primary goals of this site is to expose injustice, to shine a cleansing, revealing light to help the public become better informed and enlightened in the understanding and defense of our inalienable constitutional rights as American citizens.” Studio News Network also proclaims themselves a conservative source when asking for donations: “Can You Afford Just Ten Dollars To Help Us Keep This Site Going During The Conservative Purge?” Further, the owner of this site, Jonathan Spiel has been named as a defendant in a case where he published a false report that damaged a family’s reputation and resulted in death threats.

subjectpolitics.com.name: Subject Politics
subjectpolitics.com.notes: Subject Politics is an extreme right wing news and opinion website as evidenced by their mission statement on their About page: “It is our mission to disrupt the liberal echo-chamber of victimization, moral relativism, and political correctness that suppresses honest conversation and debate.” Subject Politics uses extreme loaded language in headlines such as this: “IT’S OVER! Trump Just Went On Twitter & EXPOSED Obama’s Sick Plan! **MAKE THIS GO VIRAL.” The words “Sick Plan” is a highly negative connotation that attempts to blame former President Obama for a judges decision, where there isn’t evidence to support it. Further, in this same article they copy and paste this quote as evidence of Obama’s “sick plan”: “JUDGE WILLIAM H. ORRICK, THE FEDERAL JUDGE IN SAN FRANSISCO (spelling error), WHO BLOCKED TRUMP’S ORDER THAT WOULD DEFUND SANCTUARY CITIES, IS AN OBAMA DONOR WHO GAVE $200,000 TO GET HIM ELECTED!” There isn’t a source for this quote, so we don’t know who said it or made that claim, in fact there isn’t any source at all for this news article other than some tweets from President Trump. Furthermore, Judge Orrick did not donate 200K to Obama. He helped raise 200K through fundraising and donated 30.8K to committees supporting Obama. Whether he donated to Obama or not is not evidence of a “sick plan” to block Trump. This is a classic clickbait tactic and promotion of propaganda. Also, according to fact checkers, Subject Politics  has made false claims here and here. Lastly, Subject Politics often references very questionable sources in their articles. For example, in the article entitled “TRUMP WAS RIGHT! Obama’s Top Adviser Just Leaked His WORST Nightmare,” Subject Politics uses Rush Limbaugh as a source to support their story. While Limbaugh’s claim may be true in this case, he is an admitted entertainer and has a poor track record with fact checking. (1/31/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

sundayinquirer.com.name: Sunday Inquirer
sundayinquirer.com.notes: The Sunday Inquirer is a news website without an about page, therefore there is no way for us to tell its mission or who founded the site. They consistently publish stories without sourcing. For example, they will take a story from another source and reword it, but not ever credit where the story came from: “Japanese Single Mothers Facing Poverty And Battle With Dishonour”. The original story appeared in the Washington Post “In Japan, single mothers struggle with poverty and a ‘culture of shame’. In all stories reviewed, there wasn’t a single source listed, although the stories were real and able to be found via Google. There also wasn’t any evidence of bias in what was reported other than most of the stories were either shocking or ridiculous. Overall, the Sunday Inquirer is a Questionable source based on lack of an about page, poor sourcing and sensational content. (M. Huitsing 9/5/2017)

supremepatriot.com.name: Supreme Patriot
supremepatriot.com.notes: When you see a title like “Supreme Patriot” it must make you think this is a very pro-American website that loves our constitution and all American Citizens, right?  Wrong.  This is an extreme right biased website that only seems to love white Christians.  This source has questionable content regarding race and is low on the factual side. Supreme Patriot is also on Politifact’s fake news list. (11/19/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

surenews.com.name: Sure News
surenews.com.notes: Sure News is a news and opinion website that claims to report the most shocking stories without bias.  When analyzing their content it seems the most shocking stories involve African Americans and Muslims committing violent acts against whites. Extreme right wing bias that has questionable information regarding minorities. (11/14/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

syrianews.cc.name: Syria News
syrianews.cc.notes: Syria News is a news and opinion website all about Syria and the current conflict. Syria News has an extreme Pro-Syrian State bias and is highly critical of all opposition.  SN uses extreme loaded language to convey emotion against the opposition and often only presents one side of the story. We also could not find an “About” page nor any information on the authors that would give insight into their mission. We have purposely not rated this website for left or right bias because they consistently rail against both if they are opposed to the Syrian State. Another factor in placing this source in the questionable category is the use of self linking. Self linking is when you link to other pages on your own website rather than outside credible sources. Based on extreme state bias, poor sourcing, and lack of information on the website, we rate this source questionable. We are not stating the information is false, just that each article should be fact checked for accuracy. We also recognize there is a strong propaganda campaign against the Syrian State by the opposition and it can be difficult to determine where the truth lies. (D. Van Zandt 5/24/2017)

takimag.com.name: Taki’s Magazine
takimag.com.notes: Founded on February 5, 2007, Taki’s Magazine is an extreme right wing online magazine of politics and culture published by journalist Taki Theodoracopulos. According to a Guardian article entitled “The way of the Jackal”, Taki Theodoracopulos has racist views.

tashnews.com.name: TashNews
tashnews.com.notes: TashNews is a blog that publishes extreme right wing news that is usually fake. All stories favor the right and consists of propaganda. Sourcing of information is nonexistent. TashNews has published fake news such as: BREAKING: First NFL Team Declares Bankruptcy Over Kneeling Thugs. This fake story came from the satire website Last Line of Defense. Overall, TashNews is a Questionable source based on the publication of fake news. (D. Van Zandt 1/21/2018)

teaparty.org.name: Tea Party Inc
teaparty.org.notes: Teaparty.org is a news and opinion website affiliated with the Tea Party Movement. Teaparty.org presents news with extreme right wing bias through the use of loaded words and sensational headlines. They also typically publish news from far right or questionable sources such as The Angry Patriot, which is on our questionable list, as well as Politifact’s fake news list. Based on extreme bias, poor sourcing and promotion of propaganda, we rate Teaparty.org as Questionable. (5/11/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

tdnewswire.com.name: TD Newswire
tdnewswire.com.notes: TD Newswire is a garbage dump of extreme right wing bias and conspiracies.  Refers to liberals as libtards right in the headlines and has questionable content regarding race.  One of the worst right wing sites in existence. (D. Van Zandt 10/26/2016)

tdtalliance.com.name: TdtAlliance.com
tdtalliance.com.notes: TdtAlliance.com is an extreme right wing news and opinion blog. Politifact describes TdtAlliance.com as a fake news blog. They have also placed them on their fake news list. This is an extreme right website that has published fake news stories. (D. Van Zandt 6/17/2017)

teddystick.com.name: Teddy Stick
teddystick.com.notes: Teddy Stick is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. Teddy Stick publishes unverified or false news such as the story of Trump Tower being wiretapped. As of this writing there is zero evidence that this claim is true. Interestingly, the primary writer for Teddy Stick claims to be a Libertarian Journalist, however he makes a non-libertarian false report about increased crime in Sweden due to Muslim immigration. This too has been refuted by multiple sources including the libertarian Reason.com. I see nothing here related to the libertarian platform. I see a far right conservative website that publishes questionable information. Teddy Stick is also listed on Factcheck.org’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 3/18/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/7/2017)

tmn.today.name: Tell Me Now
tmn.today.notes: A web based right wing news and general information site.  Has overt bias in favor of conservatives and Donald Trump.  Publishes some conspiracy stories and has questionable content regarding race. (9/9/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

thebreakingnews.today.name: TheBreakingNews
thebreakingnews.today.notes: TheBreakingNews is a conservative news and opinion website. The site does not have an about page or any type of author information. TheBreakingNews uses excessive loaded emotional language that always favors the right such as this: “Jim Acosta attacks POTUS Trump’s uplifting speech to Texans – Trump supporters respond”. This headline portrays Jim Acosta (left) as doing something terrible to Trump, while at the same time praising Trump. This is a classic click bait propaganda headline. TheBreakingNews attempts to source their information, but often times it is to other Questionable extreme right websites such as Conservative 101. Lastly, TheBreakingNews has published a false claim via a fact checker. Overall, we rate TheBreakingNews as a Questionable source due to extreme right bias, promotion of propaganda and a poor track record with fact checkers. (M. Huitsing 9/1/2017)

angrypatriotmovement.com.name: The Angry Patriot
angrypatriotmovement.com.notes: The Angry Patriot is a very right wing biased website with many conspiracies and fake news stories.  A very untrustworthy source that was placed on Politifact’s fake news source list. (10/9/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

thebostontribune.com.name: The Boston Tribune
thebostontribune.com.notes: The Boston Tribune is a right wing biased website that is attempting to sound like a legitimate newspaper.  While some of the stories on their website are real, many are not.  Snopes has found three articles on the site that are fake news.  This source has also landed on Politifact’s Fake News List. (10/19/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

dcclothesline.com.name: The D.C. Clothesline
dcclothesline.com.notes: The D.C. Clothesline promotes extreme right wing propaganda and conspiracies and does not source to credible information. (D. Van Zandt 8/10/2016)

thedailybell.com.name: The Daily Bell
thedailybell.com.notes: The Daily Bell (TDB) is a Pro-Libertarian news site. Ostensibly. The stories on the site are a mixed bag of misleading headlines, rambling writing, and thinly disguised ads. Long on hyperbole, but short on supporting links. TDB also seems to have a personal issue with Mark Zuckerberg, as three out of the ten stories on their main page were about him. Of the stories I read for the review, two stand out as examples of the issues with TDB noted above.

thedeplorablesociety.com.name: The Deplorable Society
thedeplorablesociety.com.notes: The Deplorable Society is a blog/website with an extreme right wing bias in story selection. All articles favor the right and denigrate the left. Article headlines use extreme loaded language such as this: “BOMBSHELL: Obama Calls his Lawyers in panic as Trump uncovers the woman he tried to hide.” This headline is classic click bait as there is zero evidence to support the claim that Obama called his lawyers. Further, there isn’t use of sourcing for this article. This is an opinion piece being passed off as news, which makes it fake.

lastdeplorables.com.name: The Deplorables
lastdeplorables.com.notes: The Deplorables is an over the top extreme right wing biased news blog. Most headlines are highly sensational and the content not much different. Stories are either not sourced at all or sourced to other questionable or conspiracy websites. The Deplorables is 100% one sided and that side is extreme right. This source is also on Politifact’s Fake News List. (D. Van Zandt 6/16/2017)

theduran.com.name: The Duran
theduran.com.notes: The Duran is an online news and opinion source with a strong right wing bias.  There is evidence they have posted misleading information and they have perpetuated some conspiracies. The source does produce legitimate news with a right wing bias, so we will not place them in the conspiracy category at this time. (D. Van Zandt 11/30/2016)

thefederalistpapers.org.name: The Federalist Papers Project
thefederalistpapers.org.notes: The Federalist Papers Project has overt right wing bias in reporting.  It often publishes misleading news stories and conspiracies that amount to fake news. Has a horrible track record with fact checking. (9/12/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

fairus.org.name: The Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR)

thefreepatriot.org.name: The Free Patriot
thefreepatriot.org.notes: The Free Patriot is a news and opinion website with extreme bias. Promotes propaganda and conspiracy with little credible sourcing. (D. Van Zandt 8/10/2016)

freetelegraph.com.name: The Free Telegraph
freetelegraph.com.notes: The Free Telegraph is an online publication with a privacy disclaimer at the bottom of the page that states “Paid for by Republican Governors Association, 1747 Penn. Ave. NW Suite 250, Washington DC. Not made with cooperation, consent, or consultation, or at request or suggestion of a candidate or her agent.”

thehornnews.com.name: The Horn News
thehornnews.com.notes: The Horn News is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right bias in reporting. Virtually, all stories are pro-right and anti-left. The Horn uses loaded language frequently and often sources information to far right and questionable sources. Has a false claim via Politifact. (D. Van Zandt 4/15/2017)

thelibertyeagle.com.name: The Liberty Eagle
thelibertyeagle.com.notes:
History
According to their about page “The Liberty Eagle is a privately owned, for-profit online newspaper that began publication on July 4, 2009. We provide you with news the liberal mainstream media won’t report. We have the best news aggregator technology which is designed to bring you the stories you won’t hear anywhere else.” 
Like most questionable sources The Liberty Eagle does not list any names associated with the website.
Funded by / Ownership
The website does not disclose ownership and is funded through online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
In review, The Liberty Eagle is an extreme right wing biased, conspiracy news blog that frequently utilizes strong emotional wording that always favors the right such as this: STEVE SCALISE TOTALLY SHUTS DOWN WHOOPI ON GUN CONTROL. The Liberty Eagle, many times does not source their content and sometimes they source to questionable sources such as the Gateway Pundit and Mark Levin. In general, all stories favor the right and denigrate the left. They also routinely publish right wing conspiracy theories that come from discredited sources such as NewsPunch (yournewswire).
A factual search reveals that The Liberty Eagle has failed fact checks by IFCN fact checkers.
Overall, we rate The Liberty Eagle Questionable based on extreme right wing bias, poor sourcing and promotion of propaganda. (D. Van Zandt 12/17/2017) Updated (12/10/2018)

themillenniumreport.com.name: The Millennium Report
themillenniumreport.com.notes: According to their about page “The Millennium Report provides the most important news during these times of meteoric change and pervasive upheaval.” The website does not provide information about who owns the site.

thenationalpatriot.com.name: The National Patriot
thenationalpatriot.com.notes: The National Patriot is an opinion website with extreme right wing bias. The site is run by Craig Andresen, who describes himself as “a solid conservative and keenly aware of the political landscape.” The National Patriot publishes common right wing conspiracies such as claiming The Obamassiah – More Demon Than Deity, while many stories are simply fake news, such as Trouble Brewing in the Democratic Party, which is rated False by Snopes. Overall, we rate The National Patriot questionable for factual reporting and promotion of extreme right bias/propaganda. (M.Huitsing 8/8/2017)

thenationalpulse.com.name: The National Pulse
thenationalpulse.com.notes: The National Pulse is a Washington-based political news and news media publication. The National Pulse promotes a conservative line on a wide range of issues such as Planned Parenthood, LGBT and Common Core.The National Pulse is also affiliated with the questionable source American Principles Project which advocates for immigration reform, banning abortions and denying LGBTQ equal rights.

newobserveronline.com.name: The New Observer
newobserveronline.com.notes: The New Observer has extreme right wing bias.  Publishes stories that are simply not true (fake news) and has very questionable content regarding African Americans. (11/7/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

mynewsguru.com.name: The News Guru
mynewsguru.com.notes: The News Guru is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. The founder/owner is James Ledbetter who describes himself as a freelance writer on his linkedin page.

thenewyorkevening.com.name: The New York Evening
thenewyorkevening.com.notes: The New York Evening is an imposter site, which means it is attempting to look like a New York Magazine. However, when looking at Whois, you find that this site originates from Macedonia. Like most Macedonian websites this one also has an extreme right wing bias in reporting. It also publishes conspiracy theories such as people knowing in advance that the World Trade Center Towers would be attacked. Further, this source is listed as fake news by Politifact. (D. Van Zandt 6/17/2017)

thepeoplestruth.com.name: The Peoples Truth
thepeoplestruth.com.notes: The Peoples Truth is a news and opinion blog with extreme right wing bias in reporting. Every article posted favors the right and is anti-left. The Peoples Truth does not offer an About Page or any information at all about the authors or ownership. Most headlines and articles use excessive emotional click bait headlines such as: Rex Tillerson Drops A Bombshell On John McCain – He is DONE!. Further, they use questionable sources such as Lowder with Crowder and the Conservative Patriot. Overall, we rate The Peoples Truth a Questionable source due to extreme right wing bias, lack of author information and poor sourcing. (D. Van Zandt 9/3/2017)

thepoliticaltribune.com.name: The Political Tribune
thepoliticaltribune.com.notes: The Political Tribune is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website. All articles contain loaded emotional words to favor the right and discredit the left. News information is poorly sourced to other questionable media sources or not all. In other cases they will source to a credible media outlet such as USA Today and then sensationalize the headline to mislead the reader. This is known as clickbaiting. For example, The Political Tribune sourced an USA Today story about how congress may pass a bill to eliminate past Presidents pensions if they earn more than $400K per year. This obviously would impact all living Presidents, however the headline reads: Congress Wants To CANCEL Barack Obama’s Pension! Here Is Why. This is very misleading as the story has nothing to do with directly taking away Obama’s pension. This is a classic example of a questionable source using factual information to create a misleading narrative. In other words, propaganda. The Political Tribune is also on Factcheck.org’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 7/8/2017)

thepremiumnews.com.name: The Premium News
thepremiumnews.com.notes: The Premium News is an extreme right wing fake news website. For example, they have a story entitled “Nancy Pelosi Suffers Heart Attack on Way to Psych Ward, Admitted to ICU,” which is obviously a fake news story. The Premium News is also on Politifact’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 6/17/2017)

theproudliberal.org.name: The Proud Liberal
theproudliberal.org.notes: The Proud Liberal is a news and opinion blog with an extreme left wing bias. The Proud Liberal does attempt to source, but often it is to other left wing biased sources. They also use extreme loaded words that attempt to influence the reader. This is a propaganda source. (D. Van Zandt 2/9/2017)

thereligionofpeace.com.name: The Religion of Peace
thereligionofpeace.com.notes: According to The Religion of Peace about page they are “a pluralistic, non-partisan site concerned with Islam’s political and religious teachings according to its own texts. The purpose is to counter whitewashing and explain the threat that Islam truly poses to human dignity and freedom, as well as the violence and dysfunction that ensues as a direct consequence of this religion’s supremacist ideology.”

remnantnewspaper.com.name: The Remnant Magazine
remnantnewspaper.com.notes: The Remnant is a Traditionalist Catholic newspaper published twice a month in the United States. Although its editors are not affiliated with any particular institute or traditionalist group, the paper is sympathetic to Archbishop Marcel Lefebvre and the Society of St. Pius X. Founded in 1968, it is the oldest Traditionalist Catholic newspaper in the United States.

therightists.com.name: The Rightists
therightists.com.notes: A mix of Satire and Fake news. It is on Politifact’s fake news list as a parody site. (12/22/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

therightstuff.biz.name: The Right Stuff
therightstuff.biz.notes: The Right Stuff is a white nationalist media hub that hosts several podcasts, including The Daily Shoah. It is part of the broader alt-right movement in the United States.  The website supports white nationalism and is a supporter of the belief of racialism, believing that races have different strengths and advantages, including in intelligence and strength. The Right Stuff promotes fascism so the government can enforce racial purity. This source is highly in favor of Donald Trump and his agenda. This is simply a hate group. (2/3/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 9/29/2017)

thetrumpmedia.com.name: The Trump Media
thetrumpmedia.com.notes: The Trump Media is an extreme right wing clickbait website that is littered with obnoxious and sometimes inappropriate advertising. The headlines are over the top sensationalized and the content of the articles not much better. When they choose to source, it is often to extreme right or other questionable sources. While we can’t say this source is fake news, it is very close as most stories are simply propaganda. It is probably best to visit the site to see how extreme it is, but here is an example: “Barack Obama gets Devastating News from Judicial Watch,”  In this article they source Breitbart (Extreme Right), Truth Monitor (Questionable Source-Extreme Right) and finally Judicial Watch (Right with a poor fact checking record). There is not a single credible source that ties Obama to this story. Trump Media is also on Politifact’s fake news list. (3/1/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

thetruthdivision.com.name: The Truth Division
thetruthdivision.com.notes: The Truth Division is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. Most headlines are sensationalized and there is little credible sourcing to trusted sources. Several articles reviewed amounted to nothing more than typical right wing propaganda that denigrates the left without evidence. (D. Van Zandt 2/27/2017)

unz.com.name: The Unz Review
unz.com.notes:
History
Launched in 2013, The Unz Review is a political analysis website that defines itself as an ‘alternative’ to the ‘mainstream media.’ According to Ron Unz, who is the Editor-in-Chief and the owner of the site their mission is: “I would always prefer reading something disturbing than something dull.”
The Unz Review has a long list of columnist and bloggers, although we couldn’t go through all of the list, some known names are Pat Buchanan, Steve Sailer, Ilana Mercer, and Ron Paul. Steve Sailer has been criticized as both a racist and Islamophobe. He is also listed as a promoter of hate by utilizing primitive stereotypes to describe people of color. Ilana Mercer is also listed as a promoter of hate toward Muslims, according the Southern Poverty Law Center. Further, Ron Unz has donated money to known hate groups and anti-Semite organizations.
Funded by / Ownership
The website does not disclose funding information.
Analysis / Bias
In review, The Unz Review publishes articles with loaded words such as “Trump’s Strategy Working—He’s Maneuvered Democrats, RINOS, Into Favoring Foreigners Over Americans.“ On this particular article they utilize questionable sources such as vdare.com, which is classified as an extremist White Nationalist group. They also use a different approach in which they utilize minimally loaded emotional language in their headlines such as “’Shithole Countries’: What Makes a Country? the Place or the People?” However, in the body of the article one can find plenty of racism and hate under the disguise of a philosophical discussion. Further, they also utilize factually mixed sources such as Mises Institute  and occasionally credible sources such as Consortium News and Politico, however they use them only to illustrate their far right views via questionable sources.
Overall, we rate The Unz Review a Questionable Source due extreme right wing bias, promotion of propaganda and hate, as well as utilizing poor sources. (M. Huitsing 2/12/2018) Updated (8/26/2018)

theuspatriot.com.name: The US Patriot
theuspatriot.com.notes: The US Patriot is an extreme right biased website.  They never miss an opportunity to attack liberals and promote conservatives. Unfortunately, there is an incredible amount of misinformation on this site and some stories outright fake. This is Questionable source that occasionally publishes fake news. (11/18/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

usa-conservative.com.name: The USA Conservative
usa-conservative.com.notes: The USA Conservative is an extreme right wing news and opinion blog. Most articles are highly sensationalized with strong use of loaded words to convey positive emotion for conservatives and negative for liberals. They also publish outright fake news such as the story of Trey Gowdy’s son missing. This fake story originates from the satire website The Last Line of Defense, however many conservative websites republish their stories thinking they are real. The USA Conservative is also on Politifact’s fake news list and Factcheck.org’s. (6/18/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/7/2017)

washingtonfeed.com.name: The Washington Feed
washingtonfeed.com.notes: The Washington Feed is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. This source uses strong loaded words and does not source well to credible information. Basically this is a pretty typical propaganda source. Has republished a Pants on Fire claim and is on Politifact’s fake news list. Washington Feed is also listed on Factcheck.org’s fake news list. (2/11/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/7/2017)

thewashingtonreporter.com.name: The Washington Reporter
thewashingtonreporter.com.notes: The Washington Reporter is an online news website that reports the latest political news, foreign affairs and popular culture.  The Washington Reporter states its mission as “The mission of The Washington Reporter is to practice and promote investigative journalism, political punditry and news analysis that is in the public interest.”

digifection.com.name: The Times of America
digifection.com.notes: The Times of America (digifection.com) is a website that has a domain name that is radically different then the actual brand name. The Times of America uses sensational headlines such as “Brave Muslim-Born Ex-Porn Star Triggers ISIS – Terrorists Threaten to BEHEAD Her with Gruesome Visuals” and poor sourcing to questionable extreme right sources such as the Gateway Pundit. In other cases, they republish false or unproven stories such as “BOMBSHELL: New Evidence Suggests Charlottesville Was a Complete SET-UP“, which simply is not true. Overall, we rate The Times of America Questionable based on extreme right wing bias, promotion of propaganda and the publishing of false news stories. (M. Huitsing 8/28/2017)

todaydispatch.com.name: Today Dispatch
todaydispatch.com.notes: Today Dispatch is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. Most news stories contain loaded words, with sensational headlines. Further, this source does not have an about page to indicate who they are and their mission. The articles reviewed today were primarily anti-immigrant and anti-liberal. Most articles source to right wing or other questionable sources. We rate this source questionable based on extreme bias, poor sourcing and promotion of propaganda. (D. Van Zandt 5/14/2017)

toprightnews.com.name: Top Right News
toprightnews.com.notes: Top Right News is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. All articles are pro-right and anti-left and utilize extensive loaded emotional words. Top Right News promotes right wing propaganda by taking something factual and spinning it into something misleading and favorable to the right. They also have a dismal record with fact checkers. Overall, this is an extreme right biased source that promotes propaganda and sometimes publishes fake news. We rate Top Right News as questionable. (D. Van Zandt 8/18/2017)

triggerreset.net.name: TriggerReset
triggerreset.net.notes: TriggerReset or TR is pro-gun blog that covers second amendment issues, self-defense, firearms, politics and news. On their about page they describe themselves as “TriggerReset (TR) is a web-based magazine that includes information deemed relevant to an average couple, living in the Southern United States”. The website does not disclose ownership or editors.

trueactivist.com.name: True Activist
trueactivist.com.notes: True Activist is a news and opinion website with overt left wing bias in reporting and wording.  Has a poor record with consensus science and publishes some conspiracies and always propaganda.  Has some questionable fact checks. (5/15/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

truebluescoop.com.name: True Blue Scoop
truebluescoop.com.notes: True Blue Scoop is a news site that describes itself on their about page as a news portal that provides the latest news and videos from US politics.

truetrumpers.com.name: True Trumpers
truetrumpers.com.notes: True Trumpers is an extreme right wing biased fake news blog. Every headline is sensationalized and more often than not leads to fake or misleading news. Has a Pants on Fire claim and listed on Politifact’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 4/13/2017)

trumpservativenews.info.name: Trumpservative News
trumpservativenews.info.notes: Trumpservative News is a news and opinion website that does not list the owner or authors of the articles as it appears they simply repost from other sources. Trumpservative News describes the site’s goal in their about page as “Trumpservative News exists to spread freedom of information, conservative values, and truth to the public through various media forms.”

truthfeednews.com.name: TruthFeed
truthfeednews.com.notes: First, it does not have an About page which renders it questionable from the start. Who owns it? Who writes for it? Who funds it? What is the agenda? Is this supposed to be tongue in cheek or is it real?.  Second, it is very far right biased and promotes conspiracies, which again makes one wonder without an about page if they are serious.  Truthfeed uses questionable terminology such as “thugs” to describe blacks who commit crimes. Has a very questionable fact checking record. (8/23/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

truthinmedia.com.name: Truth in Media
truthinmedia.com.notes: Truth in Media is a website owned and operated by Benjamin Swann who is an American television news anchor and journalist. He has worked in New Mexico, Texas, Ohio, Washington, D.C., and Georgia. While at Fox affiliate WXIX-TV in Cincinnati, Ohio, he began producing a fact-checking series entitled “Reality Check”, which has garnered media attention for presenting conspiracy theories. According their about page: “Truth In Media’s content echoes the honest, unabashed and groundbreaking reporting that millions of people have appreciated from Ben for many years. Our mission is to continue our role in upholding integrity and impartiality in the Fourth Estate with an exceptional lineup that shares an ambition to preserve candor in the media.”

truthmonitor.com.name: Truth Monitor
truthmonitor.com.notes: The Truth Monitor is an extreme Alt-right website that promotes propaganda. Examples: Article: JUST IN: HUNDREDS SHOT, MORE INJURED…The fact is solid – there is indeed 403 shootings by Feb 14th in Chicago.  The link to Breitbart then links to the Chicago Tribune – (should have just linked to the source and not link to a link).   False statement from article: “When the shootings continued to increase, Trump sent in more ATF agents at the beginning of February in an effort to reduce the gun crime epidemic that has overtaken the city.” – this is false.  They link to nothing however this news article the ATF denies that any new agents were sent or even Trump asking them too.    Lastly on this article it makes a statement which is not fact or lie but pure opinion.  It’s purely a biased statement often heard form the right: “Since Chicago has some of the strictest gun control laws in the country, what’s happening there serves as proof that gun control laws will NOT lower crime.”

truthrevolt.org.name: Truth Revolt
truthrevolt.org.notes: Truth Revolt is a website with extreme right wing bias in reporting and wording.  Often refers to African Americans as thugs and has published false stories. (10/2/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

truthuncensored.net.name: Truth Uncensored
truthuncensored.net.notes: Truth Uncensored is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. Every article either favors the right or is negative toward the left. There is extensive use of loaded emotional words, especially when describing news that involves liberals. Truth Uncensored also promotes propaganda, such as when they claim: President Trump Cuts More US Debt for a Longer Period of Time THAN ANY PRESIDENT IN HISTORY. While it may be true that the debt has been cut since Trump took office, the actual budget and spending is from President Obama’s fiscal year 2017 budget, which runs until September 30, 2017. Any changes in debt will not be associated with Donald Trump. This is a classic example of propaganda, where a fact is used to mislead people. In this same article they also use questionable sources such as The Gateway Pundit and BB4SP. Truth Uncensored also has a misleading claim via Snopes. Overall, we rate Truth Uncensored as a Questionable Source based on promotion of extreme right wing propaganda and the use of poor sources who have failed many fact checks. (D. Van Zandt 8/21/2017)

unclesamsmisguidedchildren.com.name: Uncle Sams Misguided Children
unclesamsmisguidedchildren.com.notes: Uncle Sam’s Misguided Children is an extreme right wing propaganda and conspiracy website. They do publish some legitimate news so they must be fact checked on a per article basis. Has a false claim by Snopes. (7/21/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

undergroundjournalist.org.name: Underground Journalist
undergroundjournalist.org.notes: Underground Journalist is a news-based blog with an extreme left wing bias in reporting. Underground Journalist currently does not have an about page, therefore who runs the site, and their mission is not known at this time. All of Underground Journalist stories favor the left and are anti-right. There is strong use of loaded emotional language in their headlines and articles such as “Ted Cruz: Americans Have No Right To Masturbate.” Underground Journalist sometimes utilizes credible sources such as jstor.org, LA Times and Politifact, however they also use factually mixed sources and sometimes they don’t source at all. Due to poor sourcing, extreme left wing bias and promotion of conspiracies, such as “Teenager Died In Her Sleep Weeks After Being Given HPV Vaccine” we rate Underground Journalist as a Questionable Source. (M. Huitsing 10/12/2017)

understandingthethreat.com.name: Understanding The Threat
understandingthethreat.com.notes: Understanding the Threat provides threat-focused strategic and operational consultation, training, and education for federal, state, and local leadership and agencies in government, the private sector, and for private citizens. What this really means is Understanding the Threat promotes propaganda about Islam as a whole. The blog articles are written well and do not use loaded words, however it is difficult to ascertain what sources they are using to draw their conclusions. Understanding the Threat is also classified as an active hate group by the Southern Poverty Law Center. We rate Understanding the Threat as a Questionable source due to extreme right bias, promotion of propaganda and its classification as a hate group. (D. Van Zandt 8/31/2017)

uniquewebmagazine.com.name: Unique Web Magazine
uniquewebmagazine.com.notes: Unique Web Magazine is an extreme right wing biased website covering news and politics that is mostly opinion based. The site has an about page which reads “very soon you will know all about us.” That is it. There isn’t any mention of ownership or mission. The site also covers tech, health, fashion, and auto news.

universepolitics.com.name: Universe Politics
universepolitics.com.notes: Universe Politics is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. UP is also another Macedonian fake news website according to Politifact. All headlines are sensationalized and most content is right wing propaganda that is misleading and one sided. (D. Van Zandt 6/21/2017)

ushealthyadvisor.com.name: US Advisor
ushealthyadvisor.com.notes: US Advisor is an extreme right news and opinion website. Every article has clickbait sensational headlines and most stories are false. For example there is story entitled: “Clinton Estate Is Officially A Crime Scene As 11 More ‘Steel Barrel Graves’ Are Uncovered.” US Advisor took this story from the satire website America’s Last Line of Defense and published it as real news. This is a fake news propaganda website that is on Politifact’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 6/22/2017)

uschronicle.com.name: US Chronicle
uschronicle.com.notes: US Chronicle has overt right wing bias in reporting.  Publishes occasional conspiracy theories and often uses questionable language to describe minorities.  Has a poor reputation with facts. (9/6/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

usherald.com.name: US Herald
usherald.com.notes: US Herald has extreme right wing bias in reporting.  Publishes some conspiracy theories and fake news such as the thoroughly debunked story of Hillary Clinton selling uranium to Russia. Routinely uses questionable language when describing minorities. US Herald is also on Politifact’s fake news list. (9/24/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

usinfonews.com.name: US Info News
usinfonews.com.notes: US Info News is a fake extreme right wing news and opinion blog from Macedonia. This source is on Politifact’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 6/22/2017)

usjournalreview.com.name: US Journal Review
usjournalreview.com.notes: US Journal Review is an extreme right wing blog without an about page. All articles reviewed were pro-right and anti-left. The content of headlines and articles use loaded words and most times quote sources that are right biased or questionable such as the Gateway Pundit. For example, the headline on the front page of the website says “CLIMATE CHANGE HOAX”, however when you click on it the headline changes to PARIS CLIMATE AGREEMENT FALLING APART AS COUNTRIES CAN’T KEEP PLEDGE, OBAMA, GORE, LAPDOG MEDIA ALL SILENT. This is misleading because in the article they do not mention anything about a hoax. This is a classic clickbait tactic. In another case they claim that in Hillary Clinton’s emails she detailed 5 different way to murder Chris Stevens in Benghazi. This is 100% false as the emails simply state where Chris Stevens is traveling to and his agenda. This is a conspiracy theory. Due to extreme right wing bias, poor sourcing, promotion of conspiracies, misleading wording, and clickbait headlines, we rate US Journal Review as a questionable source. (M. Huitsing 7/30/2017)

uspostman.com.name: US Postman
uspostman.com.notes: USPostman is an extreme right wing propaganda website that is known to publish fake news. When sourcing it uses other questionable or extreme right wing sources.  The USPostman also has a disclaimer on their website that reads: “We at uspostman cannot make any warranties about the completeness, reliability and accuracy of this information.” In other words they are trying to protect themselves from false claims. We should also note that they have a Pants of Fire claim and are on Politifact’s fake news list. (2/3/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

usaconservativereport.com.name: USA Conservative Report
usaconservativereport.com.notes: USA Conservative Report is an extreme right wing news site that does not have an about page or author information. USA Conservative Report covers news under the categories of US politics, World politics and Entertainment. They publish stories with loaded headlines such as: “Prof Who Got Booted By Lib College Because He’s White Just Won A Huge Victory” and poor sourcing. For example, they often use Conservative 101 as a source, which is listed as Questionable and has a poor track record with fact checkers. Further, USA Conservative Report has a Pants on Fire claim from Politifact for publishing fake news. Overall, we rate USA Conservative Report as a Questionable source based on extreme right wing bias, fake news reporting and promotion of propaganda. (M. Huitsing 10/5/2017)

usadailypost.us.name: USA Daily Post
usadailypost.us.notes: USA Daily Post is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion blog. All headlines are sensationalized with loaded words and the content of the articles poorly sourced. According to Politifact this is a fake news website and our review shows that to be correct. USA Daily News is also listed on Factcheck.org’s fake news list. Here is an example of a fake story from the USA Daily Post website: BREAKING: NBC Just Fired Megyn Kelly Before Her New Show Begins. This is obviously fake as her show is currently airing on NBC. Further, this is another Macedonian hosted fake website. (6/21/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/7/2017)

usadailyreview.com.name: USA Daily Review
usadailyreview.com.notes: USA Daily Review is an extreme right fake news website. Every article reviewed was fake. For example: Muslim New Jersey Mayor Just Abolished Christmas ‘To Respect Other Religions’ is completely fake. Another issue is when you click on the link to view an article a pop-up ad appears that covers the story and there no way to remove it. In summary this is a fake extreme right website. (D. Van Zandt 1/7/2018)

usadailytime.com.name: USA Daily Time
usadailytime.com.notes: USA Daily Time is an extreme right wing news and opinion blog. Produces sensational headlines and articles that are misleading or outright false. They also promote conspiracies such as the Clinton’s murdering numerous people. USA Daily Time is also on Politifact’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 6/21/2017)

usadosenews.com.name: USA Dose News
usadosenews.com.notes: USA Dose News is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion blog. All headlines are sensationalized with loaded words and the content of the articles poorly sourced. According to Politifact this is a fake news website and our review shows that to be correct. Here is an example of a fake story from the USA Dose News website: CONFIRMED ! JUSTICE RUTH BADER GINSBURG IS RESIGNING FROM THE POST OF ASSOCIATE JUSTICE OF THE SUPREME COURT.  This is obviously fake as Justice Ginsburg is still on the court and never made such a statement. (D. Van Zandt 6/21/2017)

usafirstinformation.com.name: USAFirstInfo
usafirstinformation.com.notes: USAFirstInfo is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion blog. All headlines are sensationalized with loaded words and the content of the articles poorly sourced. According to Politifact this is a fake news website and our review shows that to be correct. Here is an example of a fake story from the USAFirstInfo website: Bill Clinton son wishes Dad Happy Father’s Day with epic tweet This is a fake story as a paternity test was taken in 1999 that revealed Clinton is not the father. However, Danney Williams still claims to be the son of Bill Clinton. (D. Van Zandt 6/21/2017)

usainfront.com.name: USA in Front
usainfront.com.notes: USA in Front is a news website with an extreme right wing bias that always favors the right. A sample headline and story looks like this: http://usainfront.com/obama-administration-will-be-formally-investigated-for-potentially-criminal-act-involving-hezbollah-iran/. This story uses True Pundit as the source, which is also a Questionable Source due to the publication of fake news. USA in Front also published this fake story according to Factcheck.org. Overall, this is a Questionable source based on extreme right wing bias that always favors the right and the publication of fake news. (D. Van Zandt 1/6/2018)

usanewsflash.com.name: USA Newsflash
usanewsflash.com.notes: USA Newsflash is a news and opinion website with over the top right wing conspiracies and propaganda.  Almost everything reported on this site is factually incorrect. For example: This. (9/12/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

usanews4u.us.name: USA News for You
usanews4u.us.notes: USA News for You is an extreme left wing news and opinion blog. All headlines are sensationalized and article content is 100% pro-liberal and anti-conservative. USA News has published fake news stories such as this. They are listed on Politifact’s fake news list. This is a propaganda website that also publishes fake news. (D. Van Zandt 6/22/2017)

politicsusanews.com.name: USA News/Politics USA News
politicsusanews.com.notes: USA News is an over-the-top extreme right news and opinion website. They don’t have an about page, so one can’t be sure if this is meant to be satire. If this is not satire it must be overt fake news with the intent to mislead. For example, there is an article that reads “Snoop Dogg arrested for conspiracy.” Obviously, this is not true. This source is also listed on Politifact’s fake news list. If you like viewing a lot of ads in between the fake news then this source is for you. (D. Van Zandt 5/16/2017)

states-tv.com.name: USA News/States-TV
states-tv.com.notes: USA News/States-TV is a news and opinion website with an extreme left bias in reporting. Many articles are highly critical of President Trump and conservative policy. While many stories on this website are factual, there are also a few that are 100% false such as this one. USA News/States-TV is also on Politifact’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 6/17/2017)

usanewstoday.org.name: USANewsToday
usanewstoday.org.notes: USANewsToday is an extreme right biased news and opinion website.  It is not sourced well, if at all.  Several stories would be considered satire, but we think they are actually trying to be serious.  Has failed fact checks. (12/2/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

usapoliticsnow.com.name: USA Politics Now
usapoliticsnow.com.notes: This is a far right wing propaganda mill that advocates for conservative candidates.  The main purpose of the website appears to be the destruction of all liberals.  This source could easily be listed as a conspiracy website as most stories are devoid of credible evidence.  Makes Pants of Fire claims such as Vince Foster being murdered and is also on Politifact’s fake news list.

usapubliclife.com.name: USA Public Life
usapubliclife.com.notes: USA Public life is a news blog with extreme right wing bias in reporting. They do not have an about page, therefore the ownership of the site is not known. In review, USA Public Life has an extreme right wing bias through story selection that always favors extreme right positions and does not source to credible information. USA Public Life republishes stories from unverifiable sources such as endtimesforetold.org, that is not even an active website. They also promote propaganda by using loaded language in their headlines and articles, such as: “Is Hillary Rodham Clinton The Whore Of Babylon As Prophesied In Revelation?” Further, they sometimes use videos and then write an opinion piece with a misleading sensational headline that doesn’t match the content, such as : “Trump Just Looked Reporters In The Eyes And Said SEVEN Words That Had Them Crying.” Overall, we rate USA Public Life as a Questionable source based on extreme right wing bias, promotion of propaganda/conspiracy, and poor sourcing. (M. Huitsing 10/18/2017)

usasupreme.com.name: USA Supreme
usasupreme.com.notes: USA Supreme is a news and opinion website that has an extreme right wing bias. Used loaded headlines that don’t always match the article. Has a very poor fact checking record. Considered fake news by some sources. (11/18/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2016)

usa-television.com.name: USA Television
usa-television.com.notes: USA Television is classified as an imposter site by Politifact. This source publishes mostly fake news stories. We could not find a disclaimer that states this site is satire. USA Television is also listed on Factcheck.org’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 7/7/2017)

usaviralnewstoday.com.name: USA Viral News Today
usaviralnewstoday.com.notes: USA Viral News Today (UVNT) is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. All stories favor the right and are anti-left. Headlines and article content are littered with loaded emotional words that favor the right. USA Viral News Today also utilizes poor sources such as Sean Hannity, who has a poor track record with fact checkers. For Example, UVNT published a video that Sean Hannity released claiming that President Obama praised Islam: Sean Hannity releases 4 minute video of Obama praising Islam. This is an old conspiracy that has been debunked many times during Obama’s Presidency. Overall, UVNT is a questionable source based on extreme right wing bias, poor sourcing, promotion of propaganda, conspiracies and fake news. (D. Van Zandt 9/7/2017)

usaworldbox.com.name: USA World Box
usaworldbox.com.notes: A news website and blog that has extreme right wing bias in reporting and does not source facts well.  USA World Box is listed on Politifact’s fake news list. In general this is a right wing propaganda website. (D. Van Zandt 6/22/2017)

bloodandsoil.org.name: Vanguard America
bloodandsoil.org.notes: Vanguard America or bloodandsoil.org is a Neo-Nazi white supremacist hate group. Snippets from their manifesto:  “Our America is to be a nation exclusively for the White American peoples who out of the barren hills, empty plains, and vast mountains forged the most powerful nation to ever have existed; it is logical that America must be once again built from the ground up to recapture the glory an Aryan nation deserves.” And another: “An economy that is self-contained, and free from the influence of international corporations, led by a rootless group of international Jews, which place profit beyond the interests of our people, or any people.” Case closed! (D. Van Zandt 3/11/2017)

en.radiovaticana.va.name: Vatican Radio
en.radiovaticana.va.notes:
History
Founded in 1931, Vatican Radio is the official broadcasting service of the Vatican. Programming is produced by over two hundred journalists located in 61 different countries. Vatican Radio produces more than 42,000 hours of simultaneous broadcasting covering international news, religious celebrations, in-depth programs, and music. The current general director is Father Federico Lombardi, S.J.
Funded by / Ownership
Vatican Radio is owned by Secretariat for Communications of the Roman Curia.
Analysis / Bias
Vatican Radio (VR) is, as stated on the web site: “The voice of the Pope and the Church in dialogue with the World.”
In review, Vatican Radio exists to promote the Catholic faith to the world, and the majority of the stories on the site have a decidedly religious slant. That said, VR is not overly evangelical in its reporting. While the majority of the articles on VR focus on day to day matters concerning the Vatican, and the Pope, they do carry some non-religion world news as well. These non-religious articles are factual and presented, with a minimum of religious bias. In comparison to other religion based news sources VR is, on the whole, well written, informative, and well presented. Unfortunately, Media Bias / Fact Check judges news sources primarily on factual content and bias in reporting. 
Overall, faith based reporting, by its nature, contains an inherent bias, and presents information that is not verifiable by standard fact checking methods. For this reason, VR is rated Questionable. (D. Kelley 4/8/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/22/2018)

vdare.com.name: VDARE
vdare.com.notes: VDARE is an American website that publishes socio-political commentary pieces, particularly focusing on advocating for a moratorium on immigration into the United States as well as arguments related to race and American politics. According to the Southern Poverty Law Center, VDARE is an anti-immigration hate website which regularly publishes articles by prominent white nationalists, race scientists and anti-Semites. (11/18/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

vidmax.com.name: Vidmax
vidmax.com.notes: Publishes video’s with an extreme right wing bias. This is a propaganda site and has been called fake by other sources. Further, we were unable to evaluate more than a few of their video stories as the website is riddled with pop-up, pop-under and intrusive advertising that froze up the browser. Beware when viewing this site. (D. Van Zandt 1/13/2017)

theviralpatriot.com.name: Viral Patriot
theviralpatriot.com.notes: The Viral Patriot is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias in reporting. All articles utilize sensational headlines that favor the right and denigrate the left. The Viral Patriot typically uses other questionable sources for news, such as the Conservative Tribune, with has a terrible track record with fact checkers. The Viral Patriot website also has a store that sells anti-left and pro-right merchandise. Further, like most discredited websites, the Viral Patriot does not have an about page. Overall, this is an extreme right questionable source that promotes propaganda and uses sources that have published fake news. (D. Van Zandt 9/8/2017)

voiceofeurope.com.name: Voice of Europe
voiceofeurope.com.notes:
History
Voice of Europe is a far right website that publishes sensational stories. Although the website doesn’t list who runs the site, according to Whois the site’s registrant name is Annemiek Ploumen. According to Dutch magazine De Groene Amsterdammer (independent Dutch weekly news magazine published in Amsterdam), Erik De Vlieger is the financier and founder of the site, although he will not confirm or deny this publicly, while Daan van Seventer is the technical person. Voice of Europe doesn’t have an about page, however according to their twitter profile information they describe their content as “Conservative news network delivering you breaking news, uncensored articles and must-see videos.” 
Funded by / Ownership
Ownership is not disclosed, however Erik De Vlieger appears to be the financier and the website is primarily funded through online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
In review, Voice of Europe reports stories from European media and frames and spins them in a misleading way that always turns out negative for immigrants and the European Union: “Almost 98% of gang rapists in Sweden have a migrant background”, “Sweden reports highest number of murders in fifteen years” Voice of Europe also has a poor track record with fact checkers.
Voice of Europe’s stories consist of sensational click bait headlines and focus on a variety of topics that are mostly anti-immigrant with emotionally loaded headlines and content such as “Swedish student suspended for telling the truth about migrant sex crimes.“  Voice of Europe frequently uses factually mixed sources such as Breitbart, Daily Mail, Gatestone Institute, and Sputnik News.
Overall, this site is Questionable due to extreme right wing bias, promotion of propaganda, conspiracy theories and poor sourcing. (M Huitsing 4/8/2018) Updated (10/24/2018)

walkwithher.com.name: Walk With Her
walkwithher.com.notes: Walk With Her is a news and opinion website/blog that has an extreme left wing bias and appears to be a Pro-Clinton website from pre-election. First, there isn’t an about page that describes who owns or what the objective of this site is. Second, virtually every headline uses loaded words that are sensationalized to induce clicking (Clickbait). Within the actual articles there is use of loaded words that are often sourced to left wing or questionable sources. Lastly, like most clickbait websites this one features popup ads that make the site difficult to navigate. In the review of articles we found that some stories are true and some are flat out misleading such as: http://walkwithher.com/trumps-latest-fec-disclosure-shows-trump-has-stock-in-company-that-made-bombs-used-in-syria, which both Snopes and this website has declared unproven/verified. Further they a have a Pants on Fire claim from Politifact. (D. Van Zandt 4/10/2017)

webdaily.com.name: Web Daily
webdaily.com.notes: Over the top right wing news that is laden with conspiracy and usually not factual. Consistently publishes headlines and articles that would be offensive to minorities and Muslims. Has a questionable record with fact checkers. (11/22/2016) Updated (D. Van Zandt 6/20/2017)

weconservative.com.name: We Conservative
weconservative.com.notes: We Conservative is an extreme right wing news and opinion blog that originates from the fake news capitol Veles, Macedonia. The blog offers right wing propaganda, conspiracy theories and outright fake news. For example, they have an article just today claiming there is new evidence in the numerous Clinton murders. This simply is a fake story. We Conservative is also on Politifact’s fake news list. (D. Van Zandt 7/22/2017)

westernsentinel.com.name: Western Sentinel
westernsentinel.com.notes: Western Sentinel is a news aggregation site with an extreme right bias in reporting. All stories favor the right and denigrate the left. Western Sentinel uses strong loaded words in headlines and often aggregates stories from questionable sources such as Conservative 101. Overall, this is a Questionable source based on extreme bias and poor sourcing. (D. Van Zandt 9/4/2017)

wikiislam.net.name: WikiIslam
wikiislam.net.notes: WikiIslam was founded in 2006 by Ali Sina and Faith Freedom International. Essentially, WikiIslam is an anti-Islam wiki that purports to have 2893 articles/pages about Islam as of today.

winningdemocrats.com.name: Winning Democrats
winningdemocrats.com.notes: Winning Democrats is an over the top extreme left wing website.  Demonstrates severe bias in wording and story choices.  Has a very poor record of factual reporting. Winning Democrats produces left wing propaganda. (D. Van Zandt 11/18/2016)

thepublicdiscourse.com.name: Witherspoon Institute
thepublicdiscourse.com.notes: The Witherspoon Institute is a conservative think tank in Princeton, New Jersey. The Witherspoon Institute opposes abortion and same-sex marriage and deals with embryonic stem cell research, constitutional law, and globalization. In 2013, the Witherspoon Institute funded a study on LGBTQ families that was immediately called a “disgrace” by the scientific community. Being opposed to abortion and same sex marriage does not make a source Questionable, however, promoting a discredited scientific study to support your position absolutely earns a Questionable source rating. (D. Van Zandt 8/22/2017)

worldnewspolitics.com.name: World News Politics
worldnewspolitics.com.notes: World News Politics is an extreme right wing news and opinion website that uses strong emotional language and does not often source to credible information. (D. Van Zandt 12/30/2016)

24wpn.com.name: WorldPolitics News
24wpn.com.notes: WorldPolitics News is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. WPN has sensational headlines and is poorly sourced. It is listed as a Fake News Website via Politifact. (D. Van Zandt 4/21/2017)

worldpoliticus.com.name: World Politicus
worldpoliticus.com.notes: World Politicus is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right bias. All content favors conservatives and is negative toward liberals. Most content is not sourced at all. On March 21, 2017 they have an article up about how Loretta Lynch signed the warrant to wiretap Trump’s phone for Obama. This is published one day after the FBI and Justice Department said there isn’t evidence of a wiretap. Either World Politicus has damning evidence that they did not link to, or they are a propaganda website. You decide. (D. Van Zandt 3/21/2017)

yesimright.com.name: Yes, I’m Right
yesimright.com.notes:
History
Yes, I’m Right, is an extreme right wing biased blog that does not have an about page or disclaimer to reveal ownership and/or mission. A whois search reveals the domain was purchased in 2014 by Todays Growth Consultant.
Funded by / Ownership
Like most questionable sources, Yes, I’m right does not disclose ownership, however someone named Lara Blaine publishes most of the content. The website is funded through online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
In review, all stories favor the right and denigrate the left. There is significant use of loaded language such as: Mad Maxine Wants Trump’s Speeches to Come with Parental Advisory Warning. The source of this story and many others on the website is the Daily Mail, which has a poor track record with facts. Further, Yes, I’m Right has failed fact checks here and here. Although this is not a true fake news website, it is mostly a pro-Donald Trump propaganda website that tends to distorts facts on a frequent basis.
Overall, we rate Yes, I’m Right Questionable due to Extreme Right wing bias and the publication of false claims. (2/14/2017) Updated (D. Van Zandt 7/16/2018)

zootfeed.com.name: ZootFeed
zootfeed.com.notes: ZootFeed.com is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias. Article headlines are extremely sensationalized and often lead to content that is not sourced to legitimate content. This is a propaganda website that publishes intentional misleading stories. ZootFeed is listed as a conspiracy website by FakeNewsChecker. (D. Van Zandt 3/16/2017)

maga2020.us.name: Zox (Maga2020.us)
maga2020.us.notes:
History
Like most fake news sources Zox (Maga2020.us) does not have an about page. A whois search reveals the site is registered to Jehone Llugaliu from Podujevo, Albania. The site was founded in 2018.
Funded by / Ownership
The website is presumably owned by Jehone Llugaliu and is funded through online advertising.
Analysis / Bias
In review, Zox (Maga2020.us) is a fake news website that utilizes extensive loaded language in headlines such as this: Planned Parenthood Unearths Records of 27 Trump Abortions. This story also is not true and does not contain any sourcing information. All stories are sensational and do not appear to favor the right or left. They simply produce clickbait.
Zox also has a Pants on Fire Claim.
Overall, this is a Questionable Source due to lack of ownership information and the routine publishing of fake news. (D. Van Zandt 8/8/2018)
